Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews:
This is such a fantastic hotel. We parked in the adjacent car park. Got the lift straight to hotel lobby. As it was raining this was a godsend. 
On check in the staff were very friendly and gave us a voucher for 2 drinks as it was my husbands birthday. 
Our room was clean and very comfortable .
The food in the restaurant and at breakfast was of fantastic quality and still a great variety given the current restrictions.
We had treatments in the hotel spa. All I can say is wow well worth the money. 
Overall I loved our stay and will definitely be back.

Title: The best hotel in Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: The suite we had was amazing, I truly recommend the royal mile suite for that sexual healing - feeling  and of course the memorable wet sticky moments. The bed has no bounce so the sofa is highly recommended. Food is to die for and is very cheap to dine in with room service. My partner and I both had our own executive poo loos, although she took a fancy to mine more. Lol

Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Room was spacious, immaculately clean with lovely modern decor. The hotel was well equipped for Covid restrictions with clearly marked signage and loads of sanitising stations. Spa and pool were great and food in Itchycoo restaurant was delicious. Staff couldn’t have been more attentive.
Negative_reviews: Tiny issue but could’ve done with a bathmat in bathroom and better stocked tea/coffee/hot choc in room.
Title: Perfect one night stay.

Positive_reviews: Very comfy beds, breakfast was plentiful and everything you could possibly want was available, my daughter particularly liked the pancake maker, we had a massage in the beauty salon which was amazing and the staff in both the hotel and spa were great, no complaints at all and would definitely stay here again.
Negative_reviews: Nothing about the hotel, however as I'm pushing 60 and have already had a hip replacement, I found accessing the hotel from down in the centre of town to be a bit hilly and rather challenging, but anyone who is fit and healthy would have no problems. On the way up the hill there are lots of lovely cafes and restaurants and some speciality shops which were lovely to browse in too.

Title: Excellent stay and excellent spa too!

Positive_reviews: On arrival the staff were so polite and helpful. Stayed during the pandemic and everything is so clean with all safety measures in places and everything cleaned thoroughly. Pool and changing rooms were in immaculate condition with a booking system to ensure there wasn’t too many people in the pool. Can’t wait to come back and stay again! The hotel is right in the middle of the royal mile - meaning you are a short distance away from the station, castle & other attractions. I would highly recommend this place for its cleanliness, safety & location. Everything was in walking distance.

Title: Fabulous hotel

Positive_reviews: Stayed there for our wedding anniversary. Loved the location of the hotel, nice room, comfy bed. You're near the pubs, cafes and shops. Staff were always helpful. COVID rules were adhered to with hand sanitizer on each floor and at entrance, only 2 persons per elevator etc.
Negative_reviews: The only downside (albeit significant) was that for the 3 days we stayed there, there was no hot water in the morning due to the number of guests staying at the hotel. So if you stay there when it's quiet you won't have a problem, but if you stay when it's busy, expect to have your showers either late in the afternoon or late at night each day. The other downside was that consumables were not replaced, such as sugar and coffee but that was not an issue for us - may be for others.

Title: Very nice hotel

Positive_reviews:
This hotel is essentially a castle, just down from the actual castle, on the Royal Mile. Step out the front door and you’re on the royal mile central to all the big attractions, pubs, tours. whisky etc etc etc. 
Despite being so central the hotel itself is a haven. It’s quiet, air conditioned, comfortable, and the staff are great. Raddison Blu are always good, add to that the Edinburgh charm and you’ve got someone you’ll wish you lived! 
Roy, the concierge, is amazing. Made my birthday extra special.
Title: Hard to imagine better

Title: Great location friendly staff and great breakfast

Positive_reviews: The location of this hotel is just ideal, bang in the middle of the Royal Mile, our window was overlooking some of our favourite pubs which we enjoyed though maybe not ideal if you are bothered by noise. Room was stunning and a great size with a king size bed and comfy corner couch also.  Breakfast and bar areas were well serviced and laid out for social distancing which was reassuring. I definitely hope to return.
Negative_reviews: The mattress topper was a bit weird, making the bed very bouncy with a dip in the middle but that’s only a minor fault in an otherwise amazing stay.
Title: Fantastic stay in a lovely hotel in the ideal location

Positive_reviews: Clean tidy comfortable bed. Breakfast was amazing.
Negative_reviews: Nothing not to like about this
Title: Great weekend

Positive_reviews:
This was our first overnight in Edinburgh and we are so glad we picked the Radisson hotel. 
The evening took a turn when my partner became unwell with chest pain and we had to call an ambulance to the hotel, we informed staff of the situation and they were very attentive and helpful during a worrying time, the night manager (Tom I think?) came to us and introduced himself, he was very kind and let us know to contact him if we needed anything. The staff brought my partner water and eventually we were able to head up to our room after the drama.
Besides this, we had such a comfortable stay, the room was spotless, the staff were very friendly and professional.  The customer care and whole experience was second to none. 
We will return soon hopefully for a more chilled out stay!😊 Thank you so much.
Negative_reviews: No complaints at all.
Title: Very enjoyable stay! 5 stars from us.

Positive_reviews: My husband and I came here for a relaxing child free weekend and it was absolutely amazing, from checking in to checking out it was so easy. The superior room was beautiful and spacious. We booked a massage which was the best one I’ve had, pitty it had to end. Breakfast was perfect. Will definitely be back.
Negative_reviews: Nothing

Very comfortable bed.

Positive_reviews: Had a fantastic stay and staff bent over backwards to help us feel comfortable and safe - they were especially great with our 3 year old. Would go back without hesitation

Title: Helpful staff. Clean. Would stay again

Positive_reviews: The property location was very easy to find the property itself was lovely, as soon as we walked in and requested information for the spa usage the concierge came right over and book the whole thing for us was fantastic service walking straight through the door! The rooms are spacious, modern and very up-to date, the spa and pool facility’s are fantastic although the steam room and sauna weren’t in use at our time of visit I’m sure that would’ve put the icing on the cake for us, spa treatments and staff for the spa facilities are second to non!
Negative_reviews:
The staff for the restaurant/bar area on the evening of 5th September, could’ve had better manners and better seating area’s for food as we were going to eat at the restaurant and sadly couldn’t and didn’t want after our interaction with one of your male waiters that evening there was also an elderly lady trying to eat her dinner at a sofa and coffee table she was very uncomfortable, the lounge area isn’t suitable for dinner accommodations. Also not very accommodating trying to eat or order dinner while other members complaining at the front desk which could be heard from where we were sitting. 
The morning of the 6th we went down for breakfast to take to our room as soon as we arrived there was another member no very happy with his cutlery, we shrugged it off until we were seated to wait for our breakfast(to take to our room) we also noticed dirty cutlery at the table we were glad we were getting separate cutlery or I would’ve complained also, at current situations it’s no acceptable for a hotel of such high standards to not have clean cutlery, 
Overall if all the spa facilities were in working order, the staff had a nicer approach and the cutlery was clean it would’ve been fantastic.

We stayed for 4 nights over the long bank holiday weekend and one weekday. At check in we were told that breakfast time is till 11am. However on the morning of our checkout we were told that the breakfast is till 10:30am on weekdays. We had to miss our breakfast  and the breakfast staff could not do anything else even for our 1 year old. We did complain about this and the person checking us out did compensate us for this error on the hotels behalf.

Negative_reviews: We requested extra bed for our 8yo child. They didn't have it in the room when we arrived, but the member of staff at reception assured us it would be in a room within minutes. We went out for dinner and when we got back couple hours latet, the extra bed was still not there. Had to go to reception and ask for it again. I must say it did arrive within minutes after that. That was a minor thing, I'm not too worried about that, otherwise, everything was great.

Title: Radisson Stay

Positive_reviews:
The hotel is well situated, on High Street, near the railway station, close to the Edinburgh castle and Princes Street, so it’s easy to walk from there almost anywhere you want to visit.
The breakfast was good, lots to choose from at the buffet.
The beds were amazing, after walking all day it was easy to relax and just drift off into sleep.
Negative_reviews:
We had an issue with the staff one night, my friends were having a gathering downstairs because some of them smoke, they were not disruptive or making a mess, but a person on the staff saw them drinking some whiskey, we were after all buying whiskey that day and they were trying some out, and this person took the bottle from them, without reason, and the explanation was ridiculous, like we don’t allow drinking here? I guess they don’t allow it if you don’t buy it at their bar or something, because the glasses and ice they were using were from the hotel bar, they asked for them. Anyway, later one they ask for our property back, the bottle, because it was ours, but I wouldn’t have let them take it on the first place, if you don’t want your passengers drinking on your premises ask them to move it to the room or leave the space, but don’t touch what’s not your property.
Two nights later or so we actually went to the hotel bar, charge what we had to our room, left, were just getting settled when they called us because they couldn’t find our credit card on the system or something, we had to get back down and tried to sort it out, but the truth is we never understood what was wrong with the card they had entered when we checked in; they even asked if I wanted to put that charge on another credit card, which I said of course not, they had a credit card on their system and that was the card they should use for the charge. After not learning what went wrong, or what they actually wanted, we finally went to bed. This whole thing could have been resolved the next morning, but no, we had to try and resolve it right then and there.
Title: Great hotel

Positive_reviews: We loved the location & the lovely feel of the place. The bar area is very welcoming and the rooms are spacious and comfortable
Negative_reviews: Nothing

Positive_reviews: Rooms very nice, staff very friendly. Great location , close the castle and museum. Plenty of places to dine and eat close by.

Great location, can’t wait to go back.

Everyone can have an off day, so we put it down to that.....then had the same person check us out - no smile, no ‘how was your stay’, ‘did you enjoy Edinburgh’ - nothing!!! There were no queues, hotel was quiet due to the current corona virus. All other staff were super and friendly. We are not put off staying again - just pointing out

Title: Can’t fault it!

Positive_reviews: The hotel is in an ideal location right on the Royal Mile and is furnished to a high standard. Breakfast was fantastic and the bar upstairs was great too with phenomenal service from the staff going above and beyond to make a cocktail for my fiancé which was not on the menu. The room was cosy with a really good shower.
Negative_reviews: Only things I wasn't keen on was the parking, I thought £25 for two nights was a bit steep. Also we had requested for a cot to be set up in the room in advance but it wasn't so had to go down to reception to ask again but to be fair they had one up there in no time.
Title: Great hotel in a fantastic location, with brilliant facilties and a hearty breakfast.

Positive_reviews: The property is beautiful and right in the thick of the royal mile. The rooms were comfortable and the restaurant in the hotel was really good. Breakfast was amazing!
Negative_reviews:
The rooms were a bit dusty when we arrived and our room wasn’t cleaned whilst we were staying. The cleaner tried to come in the room to do this around half 3 but this was far too late as we had our day out already and wanted to relax in the room.
The spa was also far too small to make the most of, a tiny pool, 6 loungers and about 9 lockers.

Title: Nice, well located hotel with great breakfast

Positive_reviews: Great location on the royal mile. Superior room was very comfortable and perfect for our needs. Parking option was great. Stayed Saturday night, attended a show on Sunday arvo but could leave our car and picked in up early evening for no extra charge. Staff were great.
Negative_reviews: Very happy
Title: Fantastic venue, perfect for our needs. Great location. Short walk to Edinburgh Playhouse

Positive_reviews: Beds were super comfortable, standard room was really big, shower was powerful, always given fresh fluffy big towels, staff were super friendly and helpful. Location was excellent for sight seeing, train station, shops and pubs. Will definitely be returning for my next visit.
Negative_reviews: Nothing, could not find one fault
Title: Lovely place to stay for a break away

Positive_reviews:
The hotel is on a busy straight with loads of activity, restaurants and pubs . It is a stones through from the castle and everything is a stones throw from it . Most we had to work to an attraction was 10 mins . 
Check in was super easy and Flynn have us some advice on the best places to shop and eat , and how to get there . Room was amazing super modern , spacious and clean . Bed was a queen size and very comfy . Bathroom is clean and spacious with a great shower and toiletries. Food and drink are super tasty just a little expensive. All the bar staff are very friendly and Aaron served us one night and we had a lovely chat with him . Hotel felt very like home and was super toasty and warm during the winter In Edinburgh. 
We also got white chocolate covered strawberries on arrival, a lovely gesture
Negative_reviews: One morning our cleaning maid was not very happy that she had to return and left abruptly sighing as we weren’t ready to leave because of the long flight the night before . But that was very minor and wasn’t a big deal to us :)
Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: Everything,
Negative_reviews: The only thing I didn’t like was the hot toddy cocktail in the bar , don’t usually leave a drink 😂😂😂😂

Decided to swim,. got changed,went to the pool and immediately slipped.on a puddle and went up in the air and landed on my knee. It swelled X 3. There was nobody to help,no first aider,no medical help at all. To be fair they offered to pay for a taxi to A&E @ 2000 on a Saturday night in Edinburgh between Christmas and Hogmanay?
In the morning they paid for the taxi, arranged for a wheelchair  and an member of staff to accompany us.

Positive_reviews: We arrived for my partner's birthday which I had mentioned on my booking, we both got an upgraded room with city views as well as a birthday card and complimentary cocktail.  The bed was the comfiest I ever stayed in! 10/10 on all aspects.  I stay in a lot of hotels on business, this place is great.
Negative_reviews: Nothing to complain about, we booked a second night were having so much fun.
Title: 10/10 highly recommended.

Positive_reviews: The hotel was in a brilliant location and the rooms themselves were comfortable and nicely decorated. I don't think there was much 'superior' about our room apart from the superking bed, I don't think I would of forked out the extra money for that type of room. The staff where lovely and attentive and helpful! Couldn't fault them at all. Breakfast was brilliant with the pancake maker too!
Negative_reviews: The carpets in the hallway needed hoovering which didnt seem to happen at any point during our visit. There always seemed to be glasses/plates left in the corridor aswell, they never seemed to be in any rush to tidy it up. The bathroom was a little dingy too, the shower panel looked like it hadnt been cleaned, with black mold at the bottom seal.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
Wonderful staff - very professional, helpful, friendly and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable and in good order with a great view out to the Firth of Forth and Arthur's Seat. The bed was extremely comfortable and with the pillow menu, made for a great nights sleep on both of the nights we stayed!
Room service breakfast on the second morning was excellent and is recommended for a relaxing way to start the day. The concierge on duty was brilliant  - really chatty with a fount of local knowledge. He was very helpful with booking tickets; recommending restaurants and making dinner reservations on our behalf.
The hotel is in a great location on the Royal Mile, just a few minutes walk from Princes Street, Waverley Station, Grassmarket, Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood and well placed to explore the atmospheric 'wynds' and 'closes' 
Will definitely stay again!
Title: Very comfortable hotel & well located to explore the wonderful city of Edinburgh!

It would have been good to have had rooms of the same quality especially as we paid the same amount (which wasnt cheap!).
The TV in the room said we could connect to play own content however this was not possible despite trying. Biscuits with the tea and coffee facilities wouldn't have gone amiss!

hope to return soon

Title: Fabulous hotel for a City Break

Positive_reviews: Location is excellent but this does come with a downside in the early hours of the morning! As it is pretty close to the nightlife it becomes pretty loud out on the streets & with no "proper" double glazing... Room was well appointed but I have stayed in better for the price. Good buffet breakfast. Good attentive staff throughout the Hotel.
Negative_reviews:
Bed & pillows were way too soft for me. Unfortunately, we had a high room & due to the windy conditions had a 
whistling gale outside our window all night, obviously this isn't the Hotel's fault but worth bearing in mind when booking.
Title: Very good just a bit too pricey

Positive_reviews: The hotel was in a good location about 10 minutes away from the Christmas market. parking behind the building was handy and reasonably priced. The room was spacious and clean, bed was very comfy and loved that they had 2 different types of pillow. We payed extra to have fresh rose petals on the bed and chocolate strawberry’s in the room, the staff were very discreet meaning this remained a surprise. Had a lovely view of the hills from the window. Tv in the room wasn’t great, didn’t have many channels to choose from. Little step to get into the bathroom which wasn’t an issue but could be easily tripped over.
Negative_reviews: Check in was meant to be at 12, we arrived at 1pm and the room wasn’t ready till 3pm which was disappointing. Check out was a little unorganised didn’t seem to have enough staff on the desk.

Positive_reviews: Lovely friendly staff, quiet room for a city central location. Excellent breakfast

Negative_reviews: I paid extra for a premium room with a city view. There was just a small view of a street near by and there was no sofa area as advertised when I booked it. They had forgotten to put a cot in the room which they confirmed they would do when booking, so we rang for one which was brought to us but this was a broken one so we had to ring to get another one which got sorted. On check in we were not told about any facilities at the hotel we could use or where breakfast would be served and times for this. We were told to come back at 12.30/1pm to check in and when we arrived back to check in at 2.15pm we were told the room still was not ready for another 20 minutes which was unfortunate as our baby needed to settle with warm milk and a nap.

Title: Great Hotel and good location

Positive_reviews: Lovely clean hotel in an excellent location. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and this was one of the best EVER, staff were very friendly and welcoming and could not help enough. We arrived early and they took the luggage from us and when the room was ready took our luggage up, all while we explored Edinburgh without dragging our baggage with us. Bed was very comfortable and the room was spotless. Did not come across a single member of staff who was not smiling and courteous. An absolute credit to your company. We will be back and would definitely recommend it most highly 👍👍👍
Negative_reviews: A serve yourself coffee machine would be brilliant as the coffee is served in flasks which can get tepid quickly.....and I’m being picky now as I’m a coffee nut in the morning. It doesn’t detract from a fantastic time at a fantastic hotel.

Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: The young concierge who retreived our bags was very helpful.
Negative_reviews:
Reception staff at check-in refused to check my wife in when she arrived at the hotel without me, even though she knew the details of our stay. They were unnecessarily brusque.
This was only resolved by phoning the venue of the conference I was speaking at and asking me for the credit card details of the booking.
This problem was compounded by the manager coming to the room, admitting the receptionist had been brusque and defending their policy. A simple apology would have helped. 
I have never had this at other hotels where we have arrived separately - not an unusual occurence. 
Most decent hotels whose staff have misjudged a situation apologise and make some small gesture of goodwill - Radisson Blu could learn some lessons from them.
The result was we ate elsewhere and spent no more money at the Radisson.
When asked how was your stay on checking out we were subjected to further rounds of defence of their policy with no recognition of the embarrassment and stress caused to my wife.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Lovely big room with little extras like Nespresso machine. Good selection for breakfast. All staff very friendly and helpful. Good spa facilities.
Negative_reviews: Had to queue for breakfast on the first morning but not that long. Could do with barbells in the gym. Pool a little small.

Positive_reviews: The location, staff, food and beverage choices were good and the food tasted great.
Negative_reviews: I felt that for the price we could have been provided with some extras as my little girls was with me, no fluffy bath robes, little biscuits or snack in the room upon arrival as would be expected in a four star. The tv didn’t work each time it was turned on I had to call for assistance and the light above the bath was out making the bathroom dark.
Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: This is a fantastic location and has wonderful customer service. Everything was clean and the room was spacious. The concierge was very helpful as well.
Negative_reviews: The only thing I didn’t like was that housekeeping did not clean our room during the day when we were gone. We left the room early morning and didn’t return until early evening to see our room wasn’t cleaned at all and we didn’t have any new towels, etc. But we called the front desk and they brought up towels for us almost immediately and then shortly after housekeeping came to clean the room.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Excellent staff
Negative_reviews: Having to get out of bed to leave
Title: Exceeded expectations and that was down to the staff

Positive_reviews: breakfast was generally good with a mixture of buffet and cooked to order food. However on the first day we were not asked if we wanted anything from the cooked to order menu and assumed this was all part of the buffet. On second day we were asked and the cooked items we ordered were very good
Negative_reviews:
on check in the receptionist immediately pushed the upgrade option to a junior suite. when asked what was the advantage  we were told it would be a nicer room with a better view. As we had already booked a superior room we declined. we thought the whole process could have been handled better. e.g the receptionist could have begun by saying " we do have a special offer today ………...etc"
When we reached the our room
1)  it was extremely cold as the thermostat was set to 17. however we were able to adjust this and after about half an hour the room warmed up.  
2) the  joins on the hessian type wallpaper were beginning to come away in about 4 separate places,
3) there was a lot of accumulated dust on the skirting board below the window.
4) when we put the room card for the lights into its holder on the wall the front casing fell off,
We mentioned all of these points to a lady who was cleaning the next door room and she said she would make sure all of these points would be corrected, We then went out for a quick snack and when we returned after about an hour all of the above points had been dealt with.
Title: Overall we enjoyed our stay and particular thanks to the 2 concierges who were both very helpful

Positive_reviews: In my opinion Old Town is the best place to stay in Edinburgh and therefore location of the hotel is great as it is in the center of old town. Major attractions are in easily walkable distance (5-10mins) such as Waverley Station, Waverly Mall, Victoria Street, Grass market, Edinburgh Castle, St Giles Cathedral, shops and most importantly lot of restaurants of almost every cuisine in this area. Value for money and good breakfast.

I can only presume she was rushing 
We paid for a upgraded premier room on arrival

Size of the room was spot on
Location excellent

Title: Excellent

Negative_reviews: Traffic noise from outside. No fridge in room. Felt breakfast should have been included in cost of room.
Title: Would go back

Positive_reviews: Friendly and efficient service. Room facilities way beyond what I would expect.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Clean and comfortable and location was perfect as it was on the royal mile. Also the parking was ideal and a good price too.
Negative_reviews: View from the room wasn’t the best but in all fairness there’s an option for rooms with a better view so it didn’t bother us.
Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: Excellent location. Very helpfull staff. Room needs a bit of updating and bed was too soft for our taste but overall we enjoyed our stay.
Title: Lovely city break

Positive_reviews: Central location, good bar and lovely room
Negative_reviews: Pool area was nice but quite small. Room service choice was quite limited.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Location was excellent and room was lush
Negative_reviews: Waiting for a table at breakfast and the cooked breakfast options were all a bit soggy from the Bain Marie
Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: Location is the best, breakfast is a very good selection, staff helpful.
Negative_reviews: Expensive hotel for standard of room , but average for location.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews:
The staff went above & beyond for this stay, it was booked for my partners birthday and we were surprised with decorations and even a chocolate cake, so very thoughtful of them! 
The location was brilliant right in the heart of Edinburghs Royal Mile. 
The bed was the comfiest bed ever with the most amazing pillows - we would love to know where to get these pillows we haven’t stopped talking about them since returning from this hotel stay.
Negative_reviews: Absolutely nothing.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: The hotel was in the perfect location. Everything you need or wanted to visit was nearby. Quiet rooms.
Negative_reviews: Our room was on the side of a night club so a bit noisy at midnight for a couple of hours. However this didn’t bother me but may bother other people.
Title: Perfect location!

Positive_reviews: Bed was good friendly service and staff location was great
Negative_reviews: No fridge, full bin of rubbish in the bathroom and human hair in the bath
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: The location is excellent, and the rooms are so quiet and comfortable. The staff are lovely, especially Paul at the main check in. For a city break to Edinburgh, I would definitely recommend.
Negative_reviews: Perhaps the prices in the restaurant could be a little less, but they were not unexpected for a capital city.
Title: An excellent stay in the heart of the Old Town

Positive_reviews: Great Locations and good services. Good size room.
Negative_reviews: The bathroom may need a little upgrading soon.
Title: Shower hose is getting old and looks dirty.

Positive_reviews: Swimming pool and fitness was good to have. Good rooms as well and great location.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: great location, good size and clean room, fast wifi

Positive_reviews: Great location for the city centre
Negative_reviews: Car park should be free for people staying.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Great location
Negative_reviews: Small pool and small room
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Bed comfort and breakfast.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Excellent location; big room, well appointed; staff being helpful, including late check out, nice area to sit in foyer
Negative_reviews:
We upgraded to a ‘junior suite’... very spacious, but seemed to me to be a family room masquerading as a suite... the lounge area had a sofa bed, instead of a couch and chairs, which was very uncomfortable to sit on... and the heating on one side was a bit dodgy.
Also, ate in the bar area one night... must have had junior staff both as waiters and in the kitchen...sent a meal back.
( And as per previous feedback I’ve made for Booking.com- if you select you want parking it should be included in the price and not an expensive extra )
Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: Location in the heart of old city
Negative_reviews:
Price, very expensive.
In the description of the hotel its mentioned 4 minutes walking from edinburgh waverley station, which is correct; however, you need to go up the stairs (high stairs) between buildings opposite to the station. This is not suitable for people carrying heavy luggage. Otherwise, you need to take another route around which is longer (10-15 minutes walking).
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: The hotel is within a stones throw away from the main tourist attractions. It sits just on the Royal Mile . The Queen’s holiday castle in Edinburg , haollyrood is about 8 mins walk. The castle is a about 22 mins walk . The hop on hop off buses are like 10 mins walk or less . Very good breakfast and u can order ur eggs from menu on top of the fried eggs and scrambles eggs that are served in the buffet.
Negative_reviews: Nothing. Was perfect just the way it is and I wouldn’t change a single thing .
Title: Perfection in all sense of the word. If I am ever back in Edinburg, I wouldn’t stay anywhere else !

Positive_reviews: Great location, great very clean room. Friendly helpful staff
Negative_reviews: Everything was excellent. Nothing to complain about.
Title: A very pleasant stay. Thanks.

Positive_reviews:
Location - On Royal Mile close to castle, numerous bars, cafe's etc and Train station.
Very spacey bedroom (Superior Double type)
Superb breakfast with wide choice to suit all tastes with very attentive staff.
Negative_reviews:
Nothing of note personally but noticed that attached car park had a daily charge, although discounted for guests.
On top floors even number rooms have a chance of a decent view over to the water.
Title: Final 2 days of road trip ended with a bit of luxury.

Positive_reviews: The staff are lovely and it’s a great location. The food in the bar was great and the mud slide cocktail a must!
Negative_reviews: The breakfast. Had and early start and my mistake was I didn’t check the price. £24 for shop bought granola and nothing else inspiring. I ordered an off the menu avocado on toast and it was TINY. The breakfast is an absolute rip off.

Location of the hotel was superb.

Title: Fantastic.

Positive_reviews: Spacious room with a big, comfy bed and a small seating area.  Very clean, good breakfast selection and friendly, efficient staff.  Central location on the Royal Mile but our room was very quiet even with the window open.  TV options were good once we had got the internet connection sorted.
Negative_reviews: The hospitality tray could have been better and I don’t like having to ask for a mini-bar.
Title: Great location, comfortable accommodation and a decent breakfast.

Positive_reviews: Very comfy bed, clean room, friendly staff
Title: Very nice hotel

Positive_reviews: Great location on the Royal Mile.  Good breakfast.  Great hotel.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Great Staff, great location.  Can't fault the hotel at all
Negative_reviews: Loved everything about it.
Title: Great staff, great location.   Will definitely rebook if in Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: The bed was super soft. Location on the Royal Mile was great for shopping for woollen goods. Some of the staff went out of their way to be extremely helpful when there was a rally outside and I couldn't get a taxi.
Negative_reviews: The initial staff member at Checkin was very abrupt to the point of rudeness and kept me waiting and waiting, but the next Checkin lass was very pleasant.  The buffet breakfast was very ordinary for the price of the hotel - I had much better in 3 star hotels.
Title: Nice but not value for money

Positive_reviews: Location
Negative_reviews: Shower
Title: I w

Positive_reviews: Great location and quiet.
Negative_reviews: Mixup with our reservation.  We requested two beds, and that was not available on check-in.  No hair dryer - such a small thing!  And no fridge in our room, though there was space for it.
Title: Great location, clean, quiet and comfortable.

Positive_reviews:
The location was perfect in the middle of the Royal Mile.
The staff were very helpful and the concierge was able to recommend three restaurants within 100 yards,  We ate in two which were excellent.
Negative_reviews:
We were given a disability room which I need because I can't walk very well.  That was fine but the room was also wheelchair friendly with low wash basin, low everything in fact and only one armchair.  It was also quite a hike to and from reception/bar/restaurants, so not ideal.  But no complaints, they did what they thought they needed to do..
The hotel is a bit of a maze and quite difficult to work out access between garage parking, bedroom and reception..  Reception at ground level is on the same level as level 4 in the car park and the lift near our room did not take us down to the level of the breakfast room.  So all a bit of a traipse.
Title: A very good hotel in the centre of the Old Town

Positive_reviews: Location
Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: This was a great base on the The Royal Mile, close to shopping, attractions, pubs and restaurants.  The staff were very accommodating and friendly.  If you have a car, than you get to enjoy resident rates on parking - a big plus for us. You are within walking distance to Edinburgh Castle, Calton Hill, Princess & George St shopping - pretty much everything in the Old Town.  Recommended.
Title: Easy, friendly, and close to everything.

Positive_reviews:
The staff's service was far beyond our expectations especially from a night shift guy named "Thomas" if I'm right. We stayed on 17Sept-18Sept. We got an excellent service of food and the late check-out. We got the offer of 3-4 hours additional late checkout without any charges. The staffs were very kind, and we feel very welcome to stay in this hotel.
Dear Thomas, if you have read this message from us. Please reply or contact us back, my fiancee felt really appreciated by your exceptional service !!
Negative_reviews: Quite noisy during the night, our room located opposite the pub.
Title: Excellent staff service mind.

Positive_reviews:
Property was perfectly located for the Royal Mile.
We had a great evening meal for 7 family members.
Good breakfast. Very convenient car parking.
Triple glazed windows meant the room was v quiet.
Negative_reviews:
Can’t think of anything negative except the window design made it awkward to take photos from the room.
Health and Safety no doubt
Title: 3 nights central Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: Bed was very comfy. Would prefer to have a fridge in the room.
Negative_reviews: Room was very noisy. Will ask for room at back next time
Title: Tattoo was superb

Positive_reviews: Quiet room location despite being in the middle of the city and fringe festival
Negative_reviews: Expensive restaurant that didn't have a great variety
Title: A great hotel with great breakfast great gym and in the middle of the city

Positive_reviews: Location was excellent, on the Royal Mile, between the Castle and Holyrood Palace.  Rooms very comfortable.  Staff very helpful. Excellent breakfast.
Negative_reviews: Some areas, corridors etc a little tired
Title: Excellent location for visitors to Edinburgh; comfortable rooms and helpful staff.

Positive_reviews: Location was excellent - right on the Royal Mile. Staff were very helpful as there were a few problems with the room which, in the main , were quickly resolved. Breakfast was good but not great and the staff in the restaurant were very pleasant and friendly. We did not eat other meals in the hotel so cannot comment on them.
Negative_reviews: Room did not have any drawer space which I found unusual for a hotel of this standard. Tea and coffee were not always replaced and had to be chased up.
Title: Pleasant hotel which with a little more attention to detail could be a really a good place to stay

Positive_reviews: The location is central on the Royal mile, about equidistant from Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood Palace. Great shops, restaurants and attractions all very close.
Negative_reviews: Concierge wasn’t at their station when I needed service.
Title: Wonderful. Would stay here again.

Positive_reviews: Location was great, right in the heart of the Royal Mile, easy walk to Castle at one end and Holyrood Palace at other.  Good parking available.  Good restaurants around.  Staff all very pleasant and helpful.
Negative_reviews: Corridors/carpets etc a little tired, but actual rooms very nice.
Title: A very good location for a visit to Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: The Czech receptionist - very helpful
Negative_reviews: bar and restaurant staff not so attentive
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Big comfortable room. Modern and easily accessible. No stairs to climb as in some of the older buildings.
Negative_reviews: Kind of a steep price, and I was too tired to check out the gym, pool, etc.
Title: Comfortable convenience right on the Royal Mile

Positive_reviews: Location, very friendly staff, very good breakfast buffet.
Negative_reviews: Nothing
Title: Excellent stay

Positive_reviews: Location was fantastic, right on the Royal mile, plenty of food and drink options within minutes of the hotel. Fantastic facilities at the hotel like the gym and pool, nice large lobby too. Restaurant and Bar were great, plenty of options for breakfast too!
Negative_reviews: I honestly can't think of anything that would have made the stay better, I think the only thing was that one of the USB sockets for phone charging wasn't working, but there was 2 others in the room anyway so it wasn't a problem!
Title: Fantastic hotel, highly recommended

Positive_reviews: The location is great for tourism. Everything you would want to see (except country side) is within walking distance. Staff is courteous and helpful.
Negative_reviews: The breakfast spread needs improvement. The breakfast area is also small and it takes time to have something as you have to make orders for even simple things such as boiled eggs etc. Here I see a room for improvement. Cost on a bit higher side. So, overall it has to balance a bit to make it truly value for money hotel.
Title: Good.

Positive_reviews: Great location and also had car parking
Negative_reviews: Stayed two nights, room was not made up on 2nd day, had to ask for clean towels. Only one coffee satchet per person, so no coffee on day 2 either
Title: Central location

Positive_reviews: It was close to everything I wanted to see and do and wished I could have afforded to stay longer.
Negative_reviews: There was really nothing not to like except maybe the price
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Everything else.
Negative_reviews: The price of their Shiraz!!!!
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews:
Location 
Size of room 
Overall quality of place and staff
Negative_reviews: Car park is great but the access to the hotel is a bit grim - not a great image for such a quality hotel
Title: Good

Positive_reviews:
Good location,
Beds very comfy
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: It was a pleasant stay and very well situated . We were there for the fringe festival .
Negative_reviews: Edinburgh at this time is absolutely chaos , ( Fringe Festival ) The staff were overworked . They forgot to clean our room on one of the days . Lost an item of laundry . 3 lights in our room were fused . However the staff did try but they were working under extreme pressure .
Title: Location excellent .

Positive_reviews: Bed was really comfortable. Also we left our passports in the safe and the concierge organized a driver(naturally at our cost) to drive from Edinburgh to London to ensure the safe delivery of our passports. We needed them in order to fly back to SA the next day. This was superb service and we were so thankful!
Title: A very happy stay, fantastic location and very helpful staff.

Positive_reviews: all the staff were very helpful and friendly
Negative_reviews: i was in room 354 and felt there should  have been a mirror at the table to do hair
Title: we have stayed here about 8 times as we really love it

Positive_reviews: Wonderful hotel on a great location with helpful staff and awesome ambience where guests feel relaxed and at home
Title: Excellent experience with no problems whatsoever.

Positive_reviews: It was nice clean and excellent location
Negative_reviews: The bar fridge was nor well stocked and the room did not have milk and other standard items expected.   It was if the room was not ready or properly serviced. Expect way more from that price.   Breakfast was weak.  Nothing special and i got better breakfast at hotels half the price.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews:
The property was very well situated in the city, excellent location.   Nice hotel.
Very comfortable beds, very clean. 
Staff very helpful and friendly.
Negative_reviews:
The lift from the car park was broken had to carry suitcases up three flights of stairs to get from the car park to reception. The car park is under the hotel. 
They didn’t have my booking but “found a room” this was disappointing has we had been booked months in advance.  Had a 4th floor attic room which felt cramped with sloping roof and not the superior room I booked. 
Tried to charge me £290 a room not the £232 on the booking.   Good job I had the booking on the booking.com app as proof.
I booked breakfast but when we went to breakfast was told that we were not on the list for breakfast and they had to “find” a table. 
The staff were very nice and helpful and sorted everything thing out but it really should not have had to have been sorted out, in the first place.  
Just a bit disappointing and we felt we had to check everything, so we actually got what we had booked and didn’t get overcharged.
Title: Good location but a disappointing experience

Positive_reviews: Staff were very pleasant for the vast majority of our time.We have stayed in Radisson Blu hotels frequently and have not been disappointed.On our last evening however when the dining room had been taken over no mention that this was the case  we were unhappy with the take it or leavemail it attitude. 😈😈
Negative_reviews: The dinner menu not sufficiently varied.The hot buffet breakfast very inconsistent quality.
Title: Overall very good exception of food inconsistent in quality

Positive_reviews: The location was excellent and the room was spacious. The staff were helpful.
Negative_reviews: The adjoining door between suites was not soundproof and Mr Next door woke me at 6am coughing which continued for several hours.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: Great location. I paid for an upgrade and the room was large as a result. Nice architecture on the outside.
Negative_reviews: The view of Arthur's seat was obscured by an arcane double glazing system. Inside, the hotel feels like a big chain hotel, so not much character. Breakfast buffet was pretty poor.
Title: Expensive and like any other business hotel. Not ideal for a holiday, but great location.

Positive_reviews: The location , the staff and an amazing atmosphere!!
Negative_reviews: Nothing not to like..
Title: Everything was superb!!

Title: Would return.  Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: Location and staff.
Negative_reviews:
Expensive bar and breakfast.
Most people just walked up the road about 100m and saved a fortune.
Title: Good

Negative_reviews: Confusion with the pre booked room was annoying as the check in clerk allocated the wrong room and booking.com were blamed. On checkout we were told it was a hotel mistake and a partial refund was given. Happy in the end but annoying but to get the hill view room we booked.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: It's location was excellent and in the heat of the royal mile. The staff were helpful. The breakfast was very good.
Negative_reviews: The bathroom shower had some mould.
Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: The staff was terrific.  The room was spacious and breakfast was great.
Negative_reviews: I thought that bathroom lights could be brighter but everything else was great.

Positive_reviews: Right on the Royal Mile but down a bit so I as not in the intense crowd. I could walk everywhere - even to the Firth. Also did a lot of training on the mound as it was so close.
Negative_reviews: Housekeeping was a little hit and miss. For example, I left the tissue holder open to show it was empty and the container disappeared and there was no tissues left. Minor concern, but for the price expected. The breakfasts were fantastic. Loved the added benefit of being able to order eggs done just right!
Title: Celebrating my 60th as a solo traveler!

Negative_reviews: Both my brother in law and then 15 minutes later we were given keys to a room that was already occupied. This should NEVER HAPPEN!
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: evertyhing great, other than the bathroom just too small, but its not the end of the world.

Title: Fantastic time and would love to  return

Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: I booked this hotel on behalf of my parents celebrating their anniversary. They enjoyed their stay and was very welcomed. Had a lovely surprise in the room. Nice location near lots of resturant and shops. The spa facilities were good. Very nice and clean hotel. Location of the old town so a bit hilly for the elderly or bad knees.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Large room with all facilities, comfortable bed and great shower
Title: Excellent facilities, location, and staff

Positive_reviews: Loved the fact it was so central to beautiful Edinburgh. The staff were very helpful and friendly especially George who gave us fabulous recommendations for eating out and getting away from the tourist areas. He is an asset to you and Edinburgh. Thank you for having us.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Great Location

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: The location is undeniably the best in the city! Also, the staff were all so helpful and always pleasant. A special thank you to the Concierge, Kevin, who was very helpful AGAIN (we had the pleasure of meeting him last year).

Positive_reviews: breakfast, staff, comfort, view from room

Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Front desk staff was very accommodating and friendly. Joaquin was very helpful and professional. Hotel has a great Royal Mile location. Excellent breakfast buffet . Highly recommend this property and would stay here again.

Title: Excellent property with great location in the Royal Mile

Positive_reviews:
The breakfast and the staff were lovely from the bar to housekeeping to reception.
The location especially for the Fringe festival was amazing 
I will go back !
Negative_reviews: I asked for slippers and robes and got robes but given the cost I expect this as standard
Title: Fab location

Positive_reviews: Location exceptional, 4 minutes from the train station & at the heart of the Royal mile. Spa was wonderful & wonderfully comfortable beds.
Negative_reviews: Restaurant menu needs more choice when dining in the hotel.
Title: Awesome

Positive_reviews: Excellent breakfast - wide choice of cooked and cold items. Room comfortable as you would expect, clean and modern design. Location for the Edinburgh Fringe is perfect.
Negative_reviews: Prices very high during Festival.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: The location was amazing... check in was easy and they were happy to accommodate an early arrival... the bed was so comfortable.. just what you needed after a day of exploring
Negative_reviews: Kevin the concierge was not focused on his job at all...
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Breakfast was great.  Location excellent!!
Negative_reviews: Nothing.  Everything was perfect.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Superb facilities and rooms
Negative_reviews: Nothing
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Great location for the fringe festival and friendly helpful staff.
Negative_reviews: Room was a bit dusty under the bed and the headboard was showing signs of wear. There is a space for a fridge in the room but had to ask to have one put in (it was).
Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: Very comfortable
Title: Enjoyable

Positive_reviews:
Location is everything! Right center of the city, on Royal Mile. It's lively and around all the shops, restaurants. Walking distance to everything. We visited during the fringe festival but even with all of that crowd we did not hear the noise. We liked being right across from 3 great bars!
Staff is (okay) friendly. Room was clean and neat. We stayed for two nights then again one night after a Tour of the Highlands. And since it was my birthday, they brought cupcakes to my room and one "complimentary" drink. though it was one :( So my friend was not able to join me :(
We had breakfast one of the days, and it was good. They also offer GF bread which was amazing.
Negative_reviews:
I had a Premium room for 2 nights & a Superior room for one night and honestly I did not find any difference. Both got exact same view, one a tiny bit bigger room but honestly no huge difference so I'd say don't waste your money. 
Otherwise nothing not to like.
Title: Clean, comfy & right in the center of the city

Positive_reviews: Location was great. And they have great rooms. We reached late in the night past midnight but received great reception and very quick check in.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews:
The location is awesome. Right on the Royal Mike. 
The morning breakfast was also very good with a variety of choices.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Location was great - convenient for what we wanted.  Breakfast good.   Gave us a nice bag of brownies to eat when checking in.
Title: Excellent position for the stay when going to the Tattoo.  Comfortable.

Title: For me the only hotel to stay when going to Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: Central location, bustling with life, rooms were modern and designed well
Negative_reviews:
Definitely a business hotel and not a luxury one.  Had everything you need but quite basic.  
The room I checked into had a broken phone line and aircon wasn’t working.  However, the night shift reception, Joaquin, showed 5 star professionalism and hospitality.  He left his desk to show me possible rooms that I could move into.  Within 30 mins we had a new room with phone and aircon.  To no fault of his, unfortunately, this room was also flawed as when I checked the bathroom sink, it was full of mud.  Housekeeping had not done their job.  When I let Joaquin know, he offered and insisted that he come and clean the sink for us.  Since I had a long travelling day I declined his very kind offer and let housekeeping handle it the next day.  If it weren’t for Joaquin, I would have rated this hotel pretty poorly.  Luckily he saved the reputation of the hotel somewhat.

A short walk from the station 
Very friendly staff the bed was huge and so comfortable Room and bathroom clean 
Breakfast is remarkable I’ve never seen so much choice plenty of helpful staff 
Spa and pool very welcome 
Would thoroughly recommend

poorly  grilled tomatoes  and  mushrooms boiled. cant speak regarding meat products as I do not eat meat.
I understand its buffet and volume cooking but more attention to freshness by less quantity being prepared 
and refreshed more regular would eliminate some problems.
Would have preferred pancakes pre made, the machine was very slow when working and did not produce great quality
pancakes.  
Service was quick and good staff were very pleasant and efficient.

Title: Exceptional

Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews: Location and comfortable
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: It is located on the street where the action is. Walking distance to Edinburgh Castle and Train Station. The very helpful concierge staff are dressed in the traditional Scottish Skilt. The room is of decent size, clean and comfortable. The breakfast is also decent.
Negative_reviews: In a land of over 550 golf courses and also known as ‘the home of golf’, there’s not a single golf chanel on TV. I’m very disappointed.
Title: Modern interior Castle exterior

Positive_reviews: The property could not be in a better location. Perfect for restaurants, sites etc. could not be more perfect. The rooms were spotless. I was at the front of the hotel looking into the Main Street and it was completely silent in my room . It is a very comfortable room with modern amenities and everything you would need. The tv was huge as was the bed and I liked the large comfy couch and desk. The bathroom was also huge. It is a great hotel. A bit pricey but worth the money. You cannot go wrong staying here. The breakfast was excellent and I had a fresh made cooked omelet everyday I was there. It was gorgeous. The buffet has everything anyone would want from fruit to pancakes to eggs bacon and sausage,fruit juices and every bread imaginable. An excellent buffet. Would I say here again? Absolutely in a heart beat. Loved Edinburgh and love this hotel. The spa is great and got a manicure and pedicure from them. Wonderful pampering offered.
Negative_reviews: The people on the desk at check in could do with a personality makeover. The girl that checked me in I think was French I couldn’t tell exactly but by the few words she spoke. She never once looked at me. She was the most impersonal person. No she was actually downright rude and almost cost this hotel a good review. Don’t put rude people on your desks. There are a few of them at this hotel. The desk people are your ambassadors. You need better representation. Although the concierge desk gentleman was very nice and helpful. You could be five stars if you sent your deck people to training in how to deal with the public and customer service.
Title: Fabulous location

Positive_reviews: Staff extremely helpful.
Negative_reviews: N/A
Title: Excellent hotel,  great location, staff very helpful.

Positive_reviews: The breakfast was exceptionally good! Delicious, freshly-cooked food at a reasonable price. The bar staff were very friendly and the list of drinks was comprehensive. My son and I appreciated the very central location, just off the High Street, and it was a major bonus to have a car park on-site.
Negative_reviews: Access to and from the car park is ridiculous! The tiny ramp includes a right-angled bend which is so narrow that two cars, one entering and one exiting the car park, cannot pass. Why has the large area of hardcore directly in front of the garage entrance not been developed to widen the entrance/ exit and take out the right-angle bend?
Title: Perfect place to stay while visiting Edinburgh.

Positive_reviews: We were thrilled with Radisson Blu.  It was immaculate, beautiful, and the staff were wonderful.  We definitely will be staying there again when we visit Edinburgh, and I am looking at other Radisson Blu properties in other cities for our next trip.

Title: Excellent

Pillows: too fluffy and soft. A lower and firmer pillow is needed, although i noticed that this is an issue in all Radissons i stayed in.
Breakfast: i understand that the room can be busy, but i was never offered coffee or a la carte menu. The attending staff seemed more focused on some customers rather than other.
Restaurant: very very slow service from the kitchen. It takes a long time for the food to come out. I had to wait 46 minutes for burgers and chips (they were average, making the whole long wait even more frustrating).

Title: excellent

The check out was equally slow...and most disappointing is that they couldn't award our points award number.  We didn't have the number readily available on check-in... we had just been given it a few days prior.  But on checkout when we did have it, the staff member was very confused and didn't know what to do.  Don't promote something that your staff aren't able to speak to...especially since we had just been there 3 days prior.

Title: Perfect hotel and staff

Positive_reviews: Unbeatable location in the Old Town on the Royal Mile, in an attractive, architecturally sympathetic building that was only built in 1993, though you wouldn't know it. There is a degree of the impersonal about this hotel though it was very comfortable and modern. We did not visit the bar or restaurant on site and so cannot comment. It was easy to leave our bags at the desk after check-out as we had a late flight, and we were also able to access the hotel spa for a last minute shower before heading to the airport for our long flight, although we did not take advantage of that in the end.
Negative_reviews: I would have liked more personal service, but I think with the volume of guests coming through such an iconic location, you cannot avoid a degree of impersonality--service was always friendly and professional, but ultimately disinterested, which is fair enough for a big city. The porter took our bags to the cab rank after we checked out, and expected a tip, which we were not prepared for (coming from a society that rarely tips for service). We felt slightly embarrassed by this, as we have not experienced any such expectation travelling throughout Scotland for over three weeks.

The default option when you turn on the TV is to 'stream your own content from a device' which is great because we wanted to watch on-demand shows from our tablet.  
Great central location close to Edinburgh Castle.
Clean room, friendly staff, lots of breakfast options.

I recommend this hotel our room overlooked the Royal Mile and wasn’t noisy. Lovely fluffy white towels in bathroom.

Hotel car park is small and awkward and cannot be pre-booked. We knew this so chose to park in another car park to avoid stress and frustration. 
I ordered eggs benedict for breakfast and was surprised to be served one egg benedict. It was delicious but lonely.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Beautiful room and property. We were given a free upgrade to the largest hotel room that I’ve ever had in the U.K.  This is one of the nicest hotels that I’ve stayed in.  The property was right in the middle of the Royal Mile.  Parking was attached to the building. The staff was very attentive and polite.  The king size bed was super comfortable.
Negative_reviews: The shower water pressure was uneven, so water fluctuated  from warm to hot.  The sink fixture was very loose and flopped around.  The dimmer was broken on the lights over the couch.  Otherwise, the room was gorgeous.

Title: Pleased

Positive_reviews: The whole time we stayed here was amazing hotel staff were warm and welcoming food was lovely and got upgraded to a royal suite room so lovley the room definitely met my expectations breakfast was amazing and had lots of different choice the spa is a must
Title: Definitely recommend to anyone traveling to Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: Location wise this hotel is perfect, everything is within walking distance and the pubs opposite are brilliant. The staff are extremely helpful and hotel is immaculately clean. We didn't use the spa facilities as we were too busy exploring but had we have had more time we would of as it looked great. We were celebrating both my birthday and our first wedding anniversary and were greeted with a complementary bottle of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries in our room which was a really lovely touch.
Negative_reviews: Although the room we had which was a superior room was very roomy with all the facilities you need the bed was uncomfortably soft. It was two beds placed together with a mattress topper on the top. The pillows were equally as soft and even when we requested firmer ones they were still really soft. Breakfast was really poor. I thought we had booked this in with our stay only to be told on the final morning that we hadn't and we would be charged, this would of been perfectly fine had the breakfast been nice and had I of know after the first morning we would of eaten elsewhere as breakfast was pretty rank and not quite as they describe it online and for £12 each we could of eaten in one of the many cafes on the mile for less and probably enjoyed it.

Title: Could not have picked a better location.

Positive_reviews: The breakfast was fabulous, room, staff everything was great. Spa was lovely.
Negative_reviews:
My only bug was the lady restaurant manager on the first day when we came down to breakfast seemed like she was annoyed with me and was very short. I know it’s busy but she was really off with me /short and unwelcoming, and I don’t know why. 
The next day I had the same thing and my friend had to try and order an omelette three times and it still never turned up. Other tables who came in after us got their breakfast orders. 
I don’t think it’s fair to colour the reputation of the hotel based on this one aspect, the staff overall were brilliant and the breakfast buffet items were great but the service at breakfast was the only issue I had. The restaurant as a whole, the food when we did get it was excellent. 
I’d recommend the hotel for sure and I will stay there again. I just wanted to flag my only issue in case it helps the hotel manage quality.

Room service breakfast was a bit average (cheap though). The hotel is not cheap. OK for business travel where someone else is paying but probably too pricey for a tourist budget.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: The hotel is conveniently placed right in the centre of Edinburgh's old town and just 5 minutes walk from Waverley train station. The room matched our expectations, as did the staff and everything else about the hotel. We especially appreciated how clean and tidy everything was kept. Things like being able to choose just the right type of pillow are exactly what you need when on vacation, walking all day and exploring the surroundings. Wi-fi was great and it was very easy to watch our own content on the TV.
Negative_reviews: The TV's brightness level always felt a tad bit too low and the setting couldn't be reached via the remote control. Next time we probably won't go for the room with the view of Arthur's seat since the view, while nice, isn't breathtaking by any measure.

Title: Very enjoyable. Close to  the main town where all of the shops, bars, castle and other historic

Positive_reviews:
The hotel was in a perfect location on the Royal Mile only 15 minutes from Edinburgh Castle with many attractions and restaurants only around the corner and a 5 minute hike upwards from the train station. They provided a nice touch for my partners birthday and arranged for a cake and chocolate strawberries be delivered to the room.
The breakfast options were wide but the hot food buffet wasn't the best, albeit there was a wide selection. The cold food options tasted much better from the buffet. The options for eggs cooked was a nice touch, given we could chose from omelette/ eggs benedict and boiled eggs, the first two were great :)
Negative_reviews: On the breakfast the hot food options weren't the best, i.e. the sausages had a strong taste of herbs to them and the bacon was still fatty around the edges which wasn't our preference.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: They had left a bday card and cupcakes and gave us complimentary drinks as was my partners birthday. Was lovely touch
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: The location of the hotel was ideal on the Royal Mile, a short walk to all of the main attractions. The car park was accessible by a lift straight in to the hotel so no pulling suitcases up the cobbled streets.
Negative_reviews: The superior room was in what felt like attic conversion with low ceilings and a tiny window. I know it’s a traditional property but I’d say the room we were in was more of what I’d expect in a standard room in a hotel of this quality. There was a pillow menu left on the bed which would have been ideal if there had been any alternative pillows available. When calling reception to request an anti allergy one we were told there were none. Not ideal when all the pillows in the room  are soft feather ones. What might be “luxury” for some isn’t for others.

The room was fantastic and a good size room with a really comfortable bed and had everything you could need. 
Breakfast you had a really good selection of food and it was never too busy. 
Overall will be coming back at some point in the future and look to stay at other Radisson blu hotels.

Title: Amazing hotel and friendly staff. Perfect location for tourists.

We stayed in a Premium room and it was spacious, modern and had a view of the royal mile. The bed was one of the comfiest we've slept in at a hotel in a long time, and the shower was excellent. All-in-all it was a wonderful stay, and I highly recommend it to those seeking accomodation in Edinburgh.

Title: Great hotel

Positive_reviews: We were surprised by how large room 364 was, very spacious and comfortable. We made use of the fridge in the room, having brought sandwiches and the complimentary water in the room. The view of Arthur's Seat and the sea was a lovely sight to wake up to, even on the misty mornings. Two of the mornings we woke to clear blue sky and no clouds, perfect for exploring the city. The hotel was perfectly situated for all the activities we had planned for our stay. We also made use of the pool facilities, which was a perfect way to end our stay.
Negative_reviews: I would like to have made use of the pillow menu, as the ones supplied were by far too soft and shallow for me and my partner. Also, the toilet was a little too high for my short legs, which dangled a bit. I have in the past pulled my Achilles tendon from another hotel with this same issue, so it is a concern of mine. We were awakened on our first morning at 9am by the cleaning service as we forgot to use the do not disturb sign, but as it was our first day we felt we didn't need anything.
Title: Lucky - the perfect weather for a city break!

Negative_reviews:
I booked the more expensive room that should allow you to "upgrade" your bed - so if you want different cushions or a harder bed they can make it work for you. My bed was so soft that you literally rolled to the middle and could not move... Asked them to change it and they said it's not possible. So definitely not worth the extra cost at all.
There's also no mini bar in the room. You have to request one, and after the bed let down I just wasn't in the mood to ask. 
The cost of room service is exuberant due to a "plate charge" that they add.

Title: Comfortable but over priced.

Positive_reviews: conveniently located for food and local attractions. Parking was a good plus as city parking can be very expensive. The staff were very helpful locating halal places to eat. Over all had a great experience at the hotel.
Negative_reviews: We had a twin room and the beds were a little on the small side, (but that might have been because iv not slept on a single bed for years). It was little noisy around the back because of the crowds coming out of the night club.
Title: Location Location Location

Positive_reviews: This is our second time staying at this Radisson Blu and we absolutely loved it. Special shout out to Claire and Jessica who went above and beyond for us. We came to celebrate our birthdays and were pleasantly surprised to receive a really nice card as well as free drinks at the bar. When an alarm went off in our room (malfunction), it was promptly taken care of and we also received free drinks and snacks due to the inconvenience. You can tell that the staff really go above and beyond here! The room is gorgeous, the location is absolutely perfect, and the pool area is so relaxing.
Negative_reviews: Our bedding was a bit dirty (a few stains/spots) but honestly, it didn't bother us and we knew it was washed.

Complementary glasses of champagne were provided, chocolate covered strawberries as well as a small gift of chocolates & Biscuits. It is a FAB hotel, amazing staff and will definitely be returning - THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

The heating wasn’t working in my room, I was freezing. I reported it twice and asked for a blanket, which was kindly brought to my room. I was offered an electric heater, which I declined.
My bathroom was an accessible bathroom, which I did not request and it was quite annoying as it was shower only and everything was very low down (to cater for people who are. only able to sit on a chair in the shower)
I ordered room service for my evening meal (veg curry) and it was really tasteless and a bit cold by the time it got to me.

The staff were so helpful and I had a great time.  It is the best of the various Radisson Blu hotels I have stayed in, in terms of facilities, staff helpfulness and comfort.

Title: Great trip away, would use this hotel again.

Positive_reviews:
The room was very spacious for a city centre location. The bathroom was also a good size. Great size for two adults to share. 
Location - absolutely perfect. Easy walking distance from all major attractions including the castle, Grassmarket, National Museum, the Palace and Parliament Building. Waverley station is a 3 minute walk where the airport bus drops you off and you can get the open top bus. 
Staff - arrived at 9am and the reception staff found a room available for us (which we did not expect at that time). Very accommodating and the concierge advised us how to obtain entrance to the castle, royal yacht and the open top bus for a combined price, saving us quite a lot.
Negative_reviews: Only minor complaint would be the opening times of the gym on a weekend. However, this takes nothing away from the hotel and is simply personal preference.

This time it was amazing again and in our room there was a champagne and biscuits for us and it was a terrific surprise. We loved comfy beds and nice view. A breakfast was great, there was a good choice of everything and I absolutely loved and avocado toast. Staff is very nice and friendly and they would do everything for you. The hotel has great location and there are many shops and restaurants around. I would recommend it 10/10 :)

Positive_reviews:
The staff were amazing. I needed to arrange a little Christmas magic for my daughter and they were so helpful. Problems were dealt with right away and they went above and beyond to make our stay special - one of the restaurant staff even worked with the kitchen so my daughter could have a carrot to give Santa for his reindeer. Lovely all round. 
The pool was fantastic & mostly empty & the buffet breakfast was fantastic value as kids eat for free when an adult is eating. Really great hotels for families. Everything you could want to see is an easy walk away.
Negative_reviews:
We had a minor problem in that when we arrived there was someone else's food in the mini bar (always makes you wonder what else they missed!) but it was dealt with quickly. 
Other thing is that the room descriptions aren't consistent across their marketing materials so we thought we had booked one thing and ended up with another but the staff were wonderful and we ended up in an even nicer business room which really made our stay.

Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: The staff primarily - incredibly helpful! Got a personal visit from the manager to try and fix the tv/telephone issue the same night I reported it. To be fair to them I didn't report the ongoing issues with the Chromecast or Wi-Fi after that, as I'd given up by that stage. Great location, and loved the decor. Itchycoo Bar (love the name!) Has great cocktails and amazing bartenders.
Negative_reviews: The iron had a hole in it, so the entire contents leaked out soaking the ironing board and my shirt. The tv didn't work at all to start with, and after maintenance checked it the Chromecast worked maybe 20% of the time at best. The telephone line was faulty, it took about five goes to get to reception each time, at which point the line was terrible...like a very poor mobile call, but on a landline. The Wi-Fi was incredibly bad, lost connection to the internet all the time - the Chromecast had a permanent "unable to connect to internet" error. And as a last point, the hot water tap in the bath is well positioned for a shower, but if you're having a bath it means having to stand up every time you want more hot water.

Not good enough for a 4* hotel. I’ve had problems with the housekeeping not doing their job at this hotel on previous visits.

Title: Exceptional

Title: Ideal location

Positive_reviews: Adored our stay! Clean, tidy, well kept generally, good food, lovely small spa included in price, good value treatments, excellent location, bed was amazing - pillow menu!!! Easy parking at good price (£12.50 for a night)   One reception member stood out for being helpful and happy - she was delighted for us that we were self driving to Skye. She oozed enthusiasm in a genuine way - it didn’t feel at all put on. (Blonde lady, working late evening on Wed 7 Nov - I wish I knew her name as I would love her to get recognition.)
Negative_reviews: We weren’t clear that the spa facilities were included so had pre-booked a spa package to include it. The spa staff cancelled it no bother. I just might have picked a different treatment as I had selected based on such good value for the package rather than individual treatment. That said I enjoyed what I had and all was well.

Positive_reviews: Wonderful hotel!  Everyone was very friendly.  The location can't be beat.  The room was very clean and the bed comfortable.  It is a bit pricey but you expect that for being on the Royal Mile.  Loved our stay in Scotland!  Highly recommend!

Title: Incredible luxury stay and fantastic location! Highly recommend

Positive_reviews: Fantastic location on the Royal Mile, it couldn’t have been better placed! Short walk from the train station, approx ten mins walk to a lot of the main attractions, the hotel bar was nice and nearby there are plenty of eateries (booking definitely recommended) this hotel was perfect and good value for money and would happily recommend. It also looks like a castle from the outside which is an added bonus. Our room was ready early and the breakfast was nice, good variety and quality food. We had a wonderful weekend here and would certainly stay here again.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Hotel was fantastic for our little get away for a night break. Great location right on the Royal Mile. Bedroom was a fantastic size with a really large and comfortable bed. Bathroom was well equipped with a good shower. Room was surprisingly quiet considering the location so obviously well insulated. Spa facilities were wonderful with a lovely pool, steam room and sauna.
Negative_reviews: The only downside was breakfast the restaurant and service were faultless. The cold food selection of meats and cheese was really nice but the "hot" buffet food left a lot to be desired. The lids were broke on some of the containers, meaning the food was dried out. The eggs were cold, and overall wasn't a great experience. Shame as everything else was fantastic.....

The fire alarm call in the late evening/ early hours was unexpected but I'm glad it worked - however the execution was very poor with staff directing us to the front of the hotel with no one actually appearing to know where we should go!! 
Also there was no one to tell us when to go back in and people were going back in before the firebragade had done there checks!! Could and should have been a better response from staff

Title: Excellent

Positive_reviews: I liked the surprise birthday gifts waiting for me and the upgrade to a business room.  I also liked plenty of mirrors to get ready. The staff took notice of the Do Not Disturb notice and got into the room when we went out briefly so it was ready when we got back.  Late night staff were very obliging when my friends and I arrived back and sat up late asking for drinks, food etc.  I used the gym which was good for a general workout.
Negative_reviews: Bed too soft/ had a quilt on the mattress plus noise from the street at 3/4am meant I got very little sleep on the first night.  My fault for booking a hotel on the Royal Mile, I should have known better as I used to live in Edinburgh!

Positive_reviews:

One improvement would be to have a walk in shower rather than a bath tub however that is just my personal preference.
Location was perfect - right on the heart of the royal mile.  Hotel parking was easy to find.
Negative_reviews: We did have to ask for a change in bed covers as there were marks on the duvet and on a pillow case but this was done straight away and the staff were very apologetic.
Title: Fabulous location, beautiful room - would stay again without a doubt

Positive_reviews: The location is excellent, the rooms are spacious and they had rental car parking.  They were very accommodating for foreign travelers.
Negative_reviews: Rooms were very warm at night.  Thermostats are locked to keep clients from adusting the temperature.  We slept very hot even without a sheet or comforter.
Title: Good
