Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: This was an amazing hotel. You cannot beat the location. When you walk out the front door, you’re right on the royal mile, in the middle of the action! The room was large and comfortable. The bed felt like a fluffy cloud and there was even a couch in the room for reading and relaxing! Parking was very convenient and we liked that you could go straight from the parking garage to the hotel through a back entrance.
Negative_reviews: We liked everything!
Title: Can’t Beat the Location

Positive_reviews: Perfect location, modern hotel, very attentive staff.  Our one-night stay was near perfect.
Negative_reviews: Our one-night stay was near-perfect, EXCEPT for one specific thing:  The caustic, cheap-smelling air freshener used to "neutralize" smells in the rooms (and, I found, elsewhere on the property, such as public toilets).  This wasn't a "signature scent" of the brand -- it's something commonly used to neutralize rooms and, in my case, brought on near-allergic reactions.  I remember the same scent being used in Aloft Hotels and in the Penguin, a cheap motel in South Beach.  But I digress.  The first room my business partner was assigned had that scent, and she couldn't be in it for more than a minute.  We asked for another room, which the hotel quickly gave us.  Thanks!  My point in all this -- there must be something else that can be used as this freshener, as it instantly brought "cheap hotel" to mind for me.  And this property is not a cheap hotel in any way, except for that scent.  Thanks for the opportunity to comment! Eric Allen / Madelyn Hammond, staying on 9 Oct 2018.
Title: Thanks for great hospitality!

Positive_reviews: Spacious and very clean room, appreciated having a coffee machine in the room.  Warm friendly staff and good food in the lobby bar.
Title: Very acceptable hotel with great staff

Positive_reviews:
The location was great, very close to the castle and Royal Mile. 
We had a superior room and the bed was amazing, so comfortable that you almost won’t want to leave the hotel to explore the city. 
The room was clean and had all the amenities needed. Thanks to Magdalena for the room service. 
The pool and steam room were also nice to have at the end of a long day in the city. 
We were able to store our luggage until 7pm the day of the checkout which was very convenient with our late flight.
Negative_reviews: While there was plenty of choice at the breakfast buffet, a wider choice of non-pork meat would be welcomed.

Title: Very Good

Positive_reviews:
Fantastic location. Very comfortable huge bed. Well furnished room and facilities.
Excellent handling of our complaint (being woken at 8.30 by the cleaner trying to enter our room). On returning to out room, a selection of tasty bits and a ticket for free drinks at the bar with a hand written card if apology.

Had to ask for robes as none in the room.
Being woken at 8.30 by the cleaner knocking on the door and then trying to come in as we didn't answer straight away, (as we'd just been woken up!) Thank goodness we had put the safety lock on!

Title: Overall a great place to stay and excellent location which is very accessible to most attractions

Positive_reviews: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the Royal Mile! The bed was very comfortable and there was adequate closet and storage space. We had a great view all the way down to the water (Room 470). The hotel restaurant is open until 10:30 which was nice when we returned late from sightseeing and still needed to eat a little something.  It was a great stay and I highly recommend it if you want to be within walking distance of most attractions.

Title: A perfect was to mark a memorable family occasion

Positive_reviews:
The service was excellent, everyone was so friendly. It was our 30th wedding Anniversary and they left us fizz and chocolate strawberries. Room was lovely and spacious with a view ew of the mile.
just perfect....
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
First, the check-in staff were very good. We arrived very early and our room wasn't ready so they looked after our bags, organised some refreshments and arranged a tour for us. Similarly, when we needed a last minute dinner booking for Saturday night, concierge was able to recommend a very good restaurant and arrange a table for us. Thank you Kenneth!
The suite was gigantic with a separate lounge room and dining area. Bedroom was large also. Only point I'd make is they could have cut down on space in the hallway or lounge room to make the bathroom bigger - bit of a squeeze for two people simultaneously. Bed was very comfortable and linen nice and cosy for cold nights in Edinburgh!
The bar staff were friendly and hospitable with a good selection of drinks. The decor and appearance of the hotel are gorgeous and totally in keeping with the old town Royal Mile.
A very enjoyable stay in a well run, friendly, luxury establishment. Would come back in a heartbeat.

Title: Great Location on the Royal Mile

Positive_reviews: The room was a good size and bathroom good, with nice views of the royal mile. All the facilities you would expect from a higher class hotel. The breakfast room and buffet breakfast itself were both excellent, plenty of choice. And some nice areas to chill out, including in the bar.
Negative_reviews:
While the mattresses and pillows were extra comfy, we had two single beds pushed together. Staff insisted this made it a king size bed. It does NOT for a couple. I spent half the night in-between the beds. There were no other rooms available the second night. Better fixings are required for the beds (you get them in other hotels).
It was positive to have a pool in a hotel in this location, however it was hidden underground and not very appealing for us.

As a result, we decided to cancel another reserved night at Radisson and moved to another hotel. Not having air conditioning properly working is not acceptable for such expensive hotel.

Title: great hotel and resaurant in a great location

Positive_reviews: The breakfast was amazing and the location is ideal for seeing Edinburgh.  The staff were really friendly and helpful.  Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in town.  Not cheap but excellent.
Negative_reviews: They didn't top things up like the water the following day, but did give us some when we asked.  This also applied to the vanity packet containing ear buds and cotton wool.
Title: Amazing hote, in Edinburgh

Positive_reviews: The hotel's location can not be beat.  We were right on the Royal Mile and walking out the door you were immediately immersed in Fringe events and the old town.  The rooms have been renovated and the air conditioning works really well.  The views from the window over the old town were beautiful and we could even see the fireworks over the castle at night during the Tattoo.  The bathrooms were nicely appointed and there was enough room to place two suitcases without having to maneuver around them.  The wifi at the hotel was really good.  The television had lots of channels and the pool in the basement was good for the kids.  The food in the restaurant for breakfast was good with tons of choices.  Even a pancake machine that the kids enjoyed making their own pancakes with.  The food and service in the Itchycoo restaurant was good and they had great choices.
Negative_reviews: The hallways in the hotel smelled a little like an old locker room.  I don't know if that is because the windows were open or if the floors need to be cleaned.  The staff upon entering the hotel to check-in were a little slow and not as welcoming as they could be.  The bathrooms have a door stop on the floor for the bathroom door, however the door stop is on the floor right as you would step out of the bath.  My daughter stepped on it when exiting the bath and almost fell.  It is a potential liability waiting to happen.
Title: Middle of the Action in Edinburgh, would stay again.

Positive_reviews: The location is perfect for exploring central Edinburgh and is especially good for the Festival.  Rooms are well-appointed with comfortable beds and excellent pillows.  There is a good functional bathroom, with adequate shelf space.  The breakfast service is efficient and there is a good selection of hot and cold food.  Front of house and wait staff are all friendly and helpful.

Positive_reviews: Perfect location, you couldn't be better placed for old town. You are right in the middle of the royal mile.  Car parking was simple, check in was easy, the room was modern, clean and very comfortable.
Negative_reviews: Breakfast, but plenty of other places nearby to eat at. We only tried it once and it wasn't very nice. Scrambled eggs only on the buffet and they tasted like powder, they did offer to make you eggs on order, but the rest of the buffet wasn't good.  The bacon was chewy like it had sat there all day. Avoid the breakfast and its the perfect hotel.
Title: Perfect location and fantastic hotel.

Positive_reviews: always stay here when w ego to Edinburgh, car park is plentiful, hotel is lovely, breakfast will last you all day.  beds are so comfortable and the rooms are clean and roomy.
Negative_reviews: the only downside we always is the door into the itchucoo bar which does not self close and if there is a wind can make the room cold.
Title: another brilliant stay

Positive_reviews: Location
Negative_reviews: Noise
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Excellent location. Spacious room. Friendly staff.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Excellent location, just in the middle of The Royal Mile! Car park is available for £12.50 per day which is quite cheap in Edinburgh. Room had plenty of modern solutions and fittings to make guests feel comfortable. Polite staff, you can request a quiet room at the back of the hotel. We stayed in cheaper hotel for a first night and regret we didn't pay more to stay in Radisson! Rooms were very  clean, bed comfortable :)
Negative_reviews: Breakfast at additional price. However there are plenty of restaurants and pubs near by where you can get Scottish breakfast cheaper than in the hotel. Nothing else really, if you stayed in Radisson hotels before you won't be disappointed!
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews:
Location .... it made the weekend so easy to get everywhere without using taxis. The hotel is excellent.
Had a fabulous time .
Negative_reviews:
I think they could take more care of cleaning the bathrooms.IE :- mould on the tiles not to bad now but will be if not addressed,and round the outlet in the sink .
Having said that a great place to stay .

The hotel gives a very historical feel on the outside, with its brick wall exterior.
However, once you step in its a world of modern amenities that we all seek.
Best of old & new I would say, and they have a beautiful spa which I highly recommend to try.

Title: No atmosphere due to no guests

Positive_reviews: As we entered the hotel we were greeted by a Lovely tall ginger chap very welcoming; he booked us into the pool and were happy. we then order room service with was great; bar staff very friendly later the next day I called again to order room service to be told the bar was closed for 2 cola I think the reception thought we were wanting alcohol we then had to go down stairs to settle up Insted of changing to our room so we could settle up once we checked out witch I found strange.
Negative_reviews:
Couple of disaster i book the Raddison as I’ve stayed in the Glasgow Raddison blue and red a couple time with my partner. And had excellent service starter the sauna wasn’t open even tho I called befoe making the booking and was told it was, I no it was because of cov19. I understand completely; just lack of communicating I feel. the fire alarm went off twice during our stay; room service wasn’t available a few times that we called down. broken lamp next to the bed. we asked for towles  couple of times to wash our self and was only give hand towles im not the biggest and I struggle to dry myself with them.  Room view was ok thought be a little better for the price paid. 
Thanks Mairi
Title: Disappointing

Positive_reviews: The staff was great - very friendly.
Negative_reviews: The level of cleaning was so low. Even if we noted that our room is very dirty when we came back for a second stay few days after our first booking, the other room was in the same poor state like the first one - dust everywhere, skirting boards were black from dust, the floor wasn’t hovered well, even the toilet was dirty.
Title: Great staff, very dirty rooms

Positive_reviews: The room was very spacious and clean. Me and my partner couldn’t imagine the most comfiest bed. We liked breakfast and half swedish buffet. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Negative_reviews: There were no spa facilities available, but it is understandable because of current situation.
Title: Weekday getaway

Positive_reviews: location
Negative_reviews: unfortunately we stayed before the lockdown again on the 7 oct 3 nights,  breakfast was very nice the food was of poor standard,  the room was nice enough ,  the restaurant experience was ok ,  the pool we used twice th first time was fine but the second time my husband and my self were swimming and a family of 6 came got in the pool , the signs around the pool clearly stated 3 only in the pool my husband and my got out as we felt pushed out , i asked the receptionist why she allowed them in the said they are the same family .  very irresponsible thing to do under the covid rules , we complained but heard nothing from your hotel
Title: strained

Negative_reviews:
Dinner menu too basic, but of course #duetocovid.
Hotel too cold, but of course #duetocovid. As if turning the heating off creates "fresh air".
Mattress was a bit odd. Sort of sunk into the middle and swallowed you up. Climbing out in the morning got the heart rate going. Kind of comfy though. Some odd scratch marks on the bed head.

Bathroom wasn’t particularly clean. The black mould on the shower screen wasn’t pleasant.  Paid a lot of money for a tiny bedroom and it was nowhere as nice as the room I stayed in before for almost the same money. Very disappointed as this was a belated night away for my 40th birthday

Everything apart from the toast and eggs had obviously been pre-made and sort-of reheated. The staff were always helpful though and I’m sure I could have asked for more had I wanted to.

Title: Not 5*

Negative_reviews: The room
Title: Was in good place to get out and about.

Positive_reviews: Location and the duty manager
Negative_reviews: Tv not working we were given another but with very limited channels. Room serviced one of the towels was dirty, had to take it to reception, given fresh towels. Breakfast was disgraceful I appreciate there are covid restrictions but to charge £21.90 per person per night which is the price the hotel advertised for breakfast when there was a choice of a Scottish cooked breakfast, omelet, porridge and avocado on toast, this I don’t think is value for money. Also your table is cleared when you get up to get orange juice and cereal, this was virtually all that was offered for breakfast
Title: High expectations of a blu standard hotel not realised

Negative_reviews: The bed was very soft. Not your fault. I should have asked for a firm bed..
Title: Thanks to your staff for making our anniversary special

Positive_reviews: Breakfast and location were superb. Most staff great.
Negative_reviews: Cleanliness and housekeeping. Honeymoon weekend having just got married during Covid crisis. You would think cleanliness would be a priority. Booked a superior room. Was told it had been cleaned and was ready. Checked in and went to room. Having a look around as you do. Someone’s old dirty top was on the floor behind one of the chairs! Obviously not a thorough clean! I hat else hadn’t they checked or cleaned! Complained and moved rooms. Next day went out and again room was supposedly cleaned while we were out. However they had failed to change the pillowcases because it was still covered in make up from the night before! If they hadn’t changed those this meant they hadn’t changed the sheets at all as the pillow was on top. I go home also means they probably hadn’t cleaned the room again. The rooms are not cheap and this is supposed to be a quality hotel but housekeeping t had let you down twice. How can anyone be sure they are safe in your hotel In Times or Covid. I have emailed the company twice and had no response. Once while still there!! Very disappointed and put a dampener on the oi mi I honeymoon. It had been a stressful enough week with getting married and cancelled reception meaning hardly any family due to Covid. We did not have the luxury of postponing. We treated our selves to this break in o give us a good start to married life. I wouldn’t have thought dirty rooms would be on the agenda!!
Title: Housekeeping needs to up their game and should be checked more!!

Positive_reviews: The location
Negative_reviews: We had a number of problems. First our tv didn’t work night one. Then we had to move the next night as they couldn’t fix but only had standard rooms and we booked superior room. Key cards didn’t work twice so had to change. Breakfast was ok but cold day one. Bar area was terrible had to drink in a different area as main bar full of non residents. It was as if we had stayed at a Travelodge and not a 4 star expensive hotel. Would not recommend to anyone.

Obviously booking.com has no priority over hotel bookings direct. 
The hotel took payment for something they didn’t have. 
I should have paid less for what was given. A twin standard room. 
Won’t go back.

Title: Average

Positive_reviews: Shocking hotel management.  Had to get a change of room.first room was dirty,bed was 2 singles pushed together, mattress was filthy. Shower was broken and dust everywhere.  Second room was clean but mattress sagging in the middle. Noticed after a massage in morning there was no hairdryer in the room,my partner had to check out with wet hair.  Also no hot water in the morning,when I asked reception they said it's because they were busy. I complained to management and was told I would get a 20%refund.  In my opinion I have had better rooms and under £40. I have stayed in a few raddisson hotels around the world all were excellent. This was the most disappointing stay anywhere.
Negative_reviews: Everything

Breakfast each day people sitting directly above us with no screens. On checkout got surprised with 12.50 / night car parking. Expensive for what it offered and certainly didn’t inspire confidence.

Really wasn’t amused

Title: Great location , but disappointed in facilities

Positive_reviews: Location good. Room ok but not enough milk, coffee and no biscuits, Had to request every day, Breakfast ok.
Negative_reviews: The check in was longer than necessary. Things were not working. After returning home we were horrified to find that we had been charged 3 times the hotel rate as our credit card had been debited 3 times. Rang manager who apologised and said overpayment would be credited back that day but still in dispute with our credit card company. Also advised we would be offered a free or reduced rate 2 night stay including dinner BUT STILL WAITING FOR THIS OFFER, We are not holding our breath.
Title: Stressful, wish we hadnt booked

Positive_reviews: Staff was friendly, rooms were clean.
Negative_reviews: I didnt like that on booking website it was not clearly stated that we had only room stay, no breakfast included. Breakfast was not great anyway. Also, we had superior room with castle view - haha, not! We had roof view with two seaguls and a mountain, no visible proper castle. No little fridge inside hotel too.
Title: Read well before booking

Positive_reviews: Hotel great however covid restrictions has ruined Edinburgh so we came home a day early
Title: Not very good due to covid restrictions

Positive_reviews: The location of the hotel is spot on and the Staff were very pleasant. Covid regulations all in place and adhered to.
Negative_reviews:
We paid to upgrade to the Royal mile suite and really wish we had not bothered. It was very tired looking and drab. The dining table was disgusting and looked very dirty (although I appreciate some of the stains could probably not be removed.)
The remote control in the bedroom had been sanitised and was wrapped up the living area one was not wrapped which made me wonder if it had been sanitised.  
Complimentary mini bar was advertised and totally understand this has been removed due to Covid but maybe a complimentary drink in the bar would have been nice to replace this.
Title: Pleasant stay but probably would choose somewhere else next time in that price range.

Positive_reviews: Very basic
Negative_reviews: The fridge wasn’t cleaned. Spilt yoghurt & milk left in it so obviously not sanitized. Carpet no vacuumed under sofa. Couldn’t open window. Not value for money but location excellent.
Title: Loved Edinburgh city would definitely return but not in this hotel

Positive_reviews: The location is great.easy to get out and about to all of the sights.
Negative_reviews: As a disabled person I rang the hotel about the parking. I chose it because it had on site parking. They assured me it was available. However when I arrived after a long drive, I wasn't able to park. This was both upsetting and embarrassing.
Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews: Man on reception was very rude. Bathroom shower head was broken, no cups or heating, again when we complained the man on reception was rude. We complained to the manager he was super helpful changed our room and gave us a complimentary drink, and apologised and reassured us that he would be spoken too. This was our 40th annerversary which was ruined!
Title: Very poor!

Title: Poor

Positive_reviews:

I wanted a coffee at midday but bar "closed" (A Thank you to the manager and receptionist who offered to make me one )
Negative_reviews: as above
Title: nice room and location, didn't bother with breakfast (paid for) as poor.

A few issues: 
1. We booked a royal mile suite so you expect everything to be of a high standard. However the a wardrobe door was hanging off the frame. 
2. A lamp plug was damaged. 
3. Phone didn’t work up on arrival 
4. BREAKFAST arrived cold and was very poor value for money. The replacement was no better. On the second day one breakfast was forgotten. It just wasn’t up to the require standard.

Aircon alarm went off in middle of the night so we had to call reception they sent someone straight away to shut it off but we had to remind reception the next day to get someone to come and fix it properly.

Title: Fair

Title: Needed a break stayed before years ago why not clean it when closed !

Title: Did not live up to my expectations  back to Premier Inn next time

Positive_reviews: Absolutly nothing apart from the bar and bar staff
Negative_reviews: Where do i start from checking in on monday  24th august checked out wednesday 27th august giving us the total wrong room paid for superier room just gave us a normal standed room until i complained then the man on reception said sorry said he would put us in a premium room which was meant to be better than a superier room but when we got into the room it wasnt what he said no sofa head board was peeling holes in sheets then we went out for a walk came back to room couldnt get in both keys wouldnt work saw hotel cleaning manager said she would get new keys came back half an hour later upon we was sat on hotel corrider floor then they wouldnt work so then had to wait another hour for lock smith to change the lock we also had a late night put do not disturb on the door but maid still tried to come in at 8.30 in the morning so woke us up anyway so no lye in we also noticed they had charged us twice for the room so had to go back yet again to reception we recieved 2 complementry drinks by this time the day had just about gone so yes fed up we was on day of checkout we was asked if we had enjoyed our stay told him edinburgh was nice but was very dissapointed with the rooms and the the over all stay and he said all rooms was the same so i said why charge more for different rooms if they are all the same he didnt seem intetested on a good note bar staff was very nice and very helpful but no would not recomend this hotel
Title: Very very dissapointed

Positive_reviews:
Great location. Very comfortable beds. Great black out curtains.
Liked the no-steam square on the bathroom mirror.
Negative_reviews:
New computer system was very slow.
Unfortunately pool etc was closed.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Location and parking good
Negative_reviews:
Check out!! Was overcharged by over £60 for breakfast which was poor service and lukewarm coffee 
We were told breakfast would be £14.50 each and were charged £28 instead each  which I didn’t see until I check my emails when home as when I asked for printed bill I was told it wasn’t possible at time so I trusted my bill would be correct which it wasn’t as there was 4 of us it was an expensive breakfast and definitely not worth it so won’t be using this hotel again

Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Location was excellent and parking facilities were good. Decent breakfast served to us too.
Negative_reviews:
Cleanliness was very poor, the room has supposedly been sanitised, but it was dusty and had an unpleasant odour, as did all the corridors. The “Premier”room was very tired and in need of a revamp. They are charging 4 & 5 star prices for a 3 star room. We also went to the bar before heading out for the night. We were told to have a seat by the barman and he told us the waiter would be over to attend to us. We sat for over ten minutes before getting up and leaving. The waiter completely ignored us for the entire time. There were 4 other tables of people in, so he was hardly run off his feet. Just a very bad attitude. On the flip side the reception staff were very good.
We accept the fact that the hotel has just come out of lockdown, but surely that was a great opportunity to clean and redecorate the rooms?
We appreciate that soft furnishings have had to be removed, but the advertised minibar was completely empty for no apparent reason. And the thick dust on the back of the couches is inexcusable. Our room was not cleaned during our stay and towels and shower gel etc., were not replenished. But to be fair this maybe down to COVID-19 restrictions. I’m very aware we could have asked staff for these, but at a 4 star hotel, you really expect this to happen as a matter of course. Edinburgh is our favourite city in Scotland for a break, and we always stay in 4 & 5 star hotels there. The Radisson Blu will unfortunately be off our list in the future for places to base ourselves.
Title: Two day stay in Premier room.

Positive_reviews: Location
Negative_reviews:
Cleanliness of bedroom very poor, staff ability to complete their job to ensure customer satisfaction.
The breakfast was also very poor and cold.
Title: This hotel does not live up to standard of group. Disappointing

Negative_reviews: The headboards looked dirty
Title: Lovely

Negative_reviews: Bathroom shower poor/ceiling had mold/only one pillow each
Title: Way over priced

Positive_reviews: The location of this hotel is ideal, right on the Royal Mile and easy to get to. The room was spacious, with a seating area and plenty of space to move about. We got breakfast included, and although the restaurant was small, there were enough options available.
Negative_reviews: We were staying at the Radisson Blu for one night following our wedding two days prior. We had contacted the hotel in advance, informing them of our reasons to stay, which must have been noted on our room booking as we did receive 2 complimentary drinks from the bar, which we were grateful for and enjoyed. However, the staff member at check in did not pay any attention as to why we were visiting the hotel, or even asked how we were doing when we approached him. Again, the voucher we had for a drink in the bar had "wedding" written on it, however the waitress never let on to it. There was no "Congratulations", or any personal feel from the staff we encountered during our stay, which we felt was disappointing.

Kept awake from 1-4am with loud shouting and screaming from the pubs and clubs after paying £195 for a superior room. Told we were not entitled to compensation as we only complained after check out! Despite having a video showing the amount of people and noise levels. We were not told this room was noisy and very disappointed. Definitely would not stay again

Title: Good

Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: The location is unbeatable. Bed was super comfy. Breakfast is also good with the option to order things from a menu as well as a good buffet selection.
Negative_reviews:
The Spa* is very deceiving from photos. This pool is tiny so please don’t book here if you actually want to be able to swim. Steam room also broke on our visit. 
I checked out and had forgotten my suit and shoes in the room. I returned a couple of hours later (same day) to collect it and was told that housekeeping couldn’t find it and so I had to fly home without it even though I knew it must of been in the building. Front of house hotel staff dealt with this matter appallingly - one member of staff even rolled her eyes and huffed and puffed at us when we said it was urgent as we had to catch a flight.
The hotel manager then stepped in and in all fairness was excellent, reassured us which was all you want as a paying customer. He said he would send me the suit when they found it (who knows how they couldn’t find it to start with being a hotel of their calibre) but anyway we left reassured we would be sent it if/ when it “showed up”.
Next day I received a call to say that they had located it and housekeeping had “put it to the side and gone home” as opposed to correctly logging it onto a system and putting it in lost property. Anyway they had my suit so that was some good news, until they tried to charge me £20-30 to post it back to me. After a stern conversation with the manager about my experience he called back to say he would send it for free. I am grateful for this but the whole thing had already ruined my stay and I won’t be returning to a Radisson group hotel again.
Such a shame as everything else was great so would have returned in the future *besides the spa point above.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Stayed a few years ago before the refurbishment and the rooms were tired - not now! Breakfast area feels cold and the layout is odd but the food and choice of fayre is good.  We had moved 200 yards down the road to the Blu for 1 night after a 3 night stay at the Radisson Collection, which is supposed to be a superior hotel. I don't think it is.
Negative_reviews: Breakfast area needs work as it is soulless and cold. The bar ambience could be improved - it feels too utilitarian.

Hotel corridor carpets old and need replacing.

 First room had mould and mildew in the bathroom said we could move and that some one would be up to see us, waited half an hour no one came, went out and had a phone call saying that if we wanted to change rooms we would have to come back now which stressed the wife out.

We wouldn't stay again.

The rooms also have a step up, change of level when you enter the room and also going into the bathroom for toilet, this is dangerous and easy to trip over it. Apparently all rooms have this except for the mobility, disabled rooms. Not good for Pregnant women.

It was also quite tight packed where the buffet breakfast was, although that area wasn't too busy when I was in, at times I can image it would be very overcrowded.  The breakfast was cold, I don't think the heating trays were keeping the food hot enough and the plates were cold which didn't help to keep the heat in the breakfast.  The quality of the food in the breakfast was good however.  There was also a heavy layer of dust on the black glass tables in the bedroom, this type of glass shows dust very obviously however the room/bathroom was otherwise very clean.

Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: Booked for two nights, checked out after one night and booked at the InterContinental The George. I showed pictures to the Manager [and another Lady] of what a run down state the suite was in and also the corridors in terms of the carpets and door casings. It was warmer on the streets of Edinburgh than it was in the room, absolutely freezing. For the money I paid it was a complete let down. We went to eat in the Restaurant downstairs, word of warning...make sure you have your thermals on, it was freezing! Whilst at the same there was a squadron of fruit flies persistently doing a fly by.
Negative_reviews: All of the above...
Title: Complete let down!

Negative_reviews: Unfriendly staff
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: Central location close to amenities . Reception staff helpful and cheery . Onsite parking .
Negative_reviews: Had to move room due to cleanliness issues. New room very dusty , green mould all round shower screen , dirty entrance door , stained headboard . Basically an unclean room with housekeeping issues . Breakfast ok and plentiful , however fried eggs greasy , bacon hard . Overpriced I’m our opinion for the level of cleanliness . 3 night stay Edinburgh
Title: 3 night stay edinburgh

Positive_reviews:
Location is brilliant, central yet calm, ok decor. Downstairs area for guests to sit and wait is great. Simon, the operations manager, despite his young age was very professional, energetic, smart and had outstanding listening skills and got the job done most efficiently.
He would make an outstanding hotel manager in my opinion and could be seen running everywhere 'putting out fires' due to limited staffing, I suspect.  Reckon should be poached by 5 star with more funds and better staff schedule mgt (here resources too low to do this well). Pool area is good. Spa is outsourced and has friendly personnel and good treatments. 
Bed was very comfortable and had good bedding. New room after cleaning mishap was clean and comfy and all our things were moved by them at my request so our day could keep going withoit further hassle. Check out time was flexible (12pm to 1pm) which was great for late departures/ later plane. Reception staff overall professional, responsive and doing their best. Female manager ok, but seemed just a good receptionist, not an energetic decision maker.
Great to have taxis in front of hotel and all tours close by and Edinburgh castle about 10 min away.
Airport bus connection (last stop) at bottom of hill. Steep 5-10 min walk to get to hotel, but managed with my 9 year old.
Negative_reviews:
I found the place a little understaffed in the cleaning department. The second floor was disappointing, but the fifth floor was great.  I didn't like one of the male back office managers tell Stefano, one of the receptionists, off in front of guests. Very unprofessional image and putting bad atmosphere into the hotel.
Also bringing luggage up was a favour as portrayed by the tone of Stefano, so that we carried our own luggage up, which does not scream 5 star. Insisting on having luggage brought down at the end of the stay took 2 phone calls to reception and one to concierge and 30 min....Concierge only there during the day. Breakfast had lots of choices but was made up of cheap options and had nothing homemade/any local specialities.
Felt like Aldi food without the organic options. No cakes.
No walk in showers. Baths need updating. No drinks were free, not even water bottles in the room...no welcome chocolate or flowers...no personalised note...no minibar....no downturn service. Big push to become a Radisson member and getting points only if not going via booking.com. Getting room service on top of prices that were about x4 also required a delivery fee! Understaffed in high traffic times (end of breakfast- time should be extended/ check out time). Kitchen and room service personnel understaffed.
A lot of cost cutting exercises, felt more 3 star than 5 star in the way it was run.
Title: Good central option for quick city break

Positive_reviews: Huge bed. Central location.
Negative_reviews: Room was full of dust. Stayed in a superior room it was bigger but superior suggests more than just space..  disappointed.
Title: Lovely break.. hotel ..disappointing.

Positive_reviews: location was great
Negative_reviews: service

Positive_reviews: Location was perfect for access to town , breakfast was good
Negative_reviews: Shower in the bath is hard to access ,

Negative_reviews: Poor leisure facilities- not a spa. Chaotic and unclean. Too many people allowed in. Terrible changing rooms. Children jumping around in pool splashing. A little noisy at night from outside which is understandable in city centre.

Negative_reviews: Room size.

Negative_reviews: We travelled with our 3 year old son and no extra bedding or towels were put in the room for us. We were also told that if we paid an upgrade that we would be guaranteed a quiet room but we had a very noisy room.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Bed was really comfy. Good parking facilities

The bathroom in the room was mucky and Dusty especially the mirror and shower screen. 
Desk below bed was the same.
Kept awake till early hours due to pubs over the road and suppose to be sound proof!
On arrival not alot of information given, restaurant? Pool? Not a clue.
Upgraded to a superior room? Didn't look like it but charged for it! Always book raddison very disappointed

Extra bed had been forgotten from the booking and the upgrade to superior room was  very disappointing. Carpets were dirty, corridors dark and no fridge in room. Not what I would expect from a ‘quality’ hotel.
Title: Dissatisfied and disappointed.

Positive_reviews: Like cot a bring provided, food was great as well. Ambience on bottom floors was good. Staff at the breakfast floor was pleasant.
Negative_reviews: Cleanliness, dust all around in the room, on lamp shades and tables. Have stayed radisson many times at different locations. Customer service was not up to mark as I have had good ones in past. That’s y I opted. Not a charming customer service at reception. We had a baby with us. Though parking is not guaranteed in the premises. Technology wise parking said full but there were still 3-4 spaces in the zone. When we told at the reception no extra mile was taken to have a look in the slots and help us. People at the reception need to be more charming and pleasant even though can’t be helped. But there should be a willingness to go to extra mile for customers and that was missing. Ordered milk for baby and took around 30 minutes and we have reminder twice.
Title: Overall stay was neutral, I will prefer other stays in Edinburgh. I don’t mind paying more.

Positive_reviews: Very good location
Negative_reviews: For an overnight city stay I would have expected to have slippers and a robe provided ... this is expected in a 4 star hotel!! Also there was no mini bar?  on arrival the bed was not made very well I thought my teenage daughter had been around ! I stayed in the RB in Istanbul and the Edinburgh version just doesn’t match up !!

Title: Was expecting far better standard and freindly staff.

Positive_reviews:

Negative_reviews:
Breakfast was mediocre; chewy hash browns, rubbery fried eggs, 'boiled' bacon rashers (obviously done in the oven), tepid coffee.
The bed wasn't particularly comfortable.
The restaurant facilities were quite poor for a hotel of this caliber.
Title: OK, but I'd look for somewhere else for my next visit to Edinburgh.

Positive_reviews: Good looking bar, good staff, very attentive on reception and bar.
Negative_reviews:
Requested early check in over 3 weeks earlier, arrived at 1pm, couldn’t check in until AFTER the standard 3pm. It was 3.45pm before we could check in. Pre ordered flowers, and rose petals on the bed along with chocolates- neither were there which was disappointing considering I told front desk to make sure they were there when they told me room wasn’t ready.  Not a free coffee or drink offered when it expires past the guaranteed check in time. They tried to compensate by leaving a bottle of Prosecco without asking if we drank alcohol (my partner doesn’t - and I wanted to surprise her with flowers and rose petals - not a bottle of fizzy wine). 
The room was basic, wasn’t kept the next day, and I had to request toilet rolls and towels. The bed was awful - apparently upgraded to a premium room although it was TWO single beds pushed together. not what you expect for £391 2 nights. Room 221.
Title: Okay

Positive_reviews: Room was a great size. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Breakfast was good lots of choice. Very nice touch with birthday note and complimentary drink of choice. Thanks!
Negative_reviews:
Staff werent very helpful.
Never told us where our room was just handed us a card and sent off. Were told our bags would be in our room when it was ready to return to our bags sitting out in the open at reception hours later.
Werent told about carpark payment or even asked if we had a car with us.
Title: Staff were not attentive. Room was beautiful and very comfortable.

Negative_reviews: Pillows were not comfortable. Dirt on the inside of the toilet bowl at the top, needs a good scrub. Not the luxury I was expecting for the price.

Sadly disappointed with aloof staff (this does not refer to cleaners and staff in the breakfast room).

Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Breakfast was excellent. Lots of choice, good quality, no wait for a table. Bed very comfortable and the room (superior) was quiet. Slept well both nights. Hard to beat the location, close to train station, Princes Street etc and on the Royal Mile.
Negative_reviews: Superior room was meant to have extras such as pillow spray and slippers but nothing like that. We were surprised, given the price, that the tea & coffee tray didn't include biscuits or any other snacks. It didn't offer any more than a Premier Inn in terms of room facilities. Expensive for what it was.
Title: Enjoyable but expensive weekend stay

Positive_reviews: The food was really nice and the bar staff very friendly.
Negative_reviews:
Unfortunately, the hotel had been overbooked that weekend which was not the hotel staffs' fault, but we had to stay the first night elsewhere. Initially, when they told us, they could not have been nicer: booking us to their sister hotel and offering complimentary drinks and a taxi which were great and we were not too bothered. 
However, when we got back the next day the receptionist was quite rude suggesting we had no idea what was going on and I did not know how to spell my own name which was quite insulting. The manager who we had to ask for was then lovely and knew the whole situation.  
Then we had to ask 5 times to have twin beds which was irritating, but the staff were lovely each time. They did offer us an upgrade and a free meal due to the disruption which was amazing. The meal was particularly good, but we only got drinks halfway through.
So I guess, we did overall have a nice stay, but it was a bit fawlty towers like where everything that could go wrong did. There were several members of staff who were wonderful but it was very hit and miss!
Title: Overall good, but gave fawlty towers a run for its money

Negative_reviews: They messed on the payments I gave them my credit card details they said they lost them
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Our toddler daughter received some crayons etc on arrival. Breakfast staff helpful and cooked separate breakfast for our daughter who has allergies.
Negative_reviews: Not enough towels provided in room for number of guests - had to go to reception to request more. Kettle faulty, bare wires showing near plug - phoned reception who understood the issue. Staff member then brought wrong part for faulty kettle. Second visit he brought full new kettle. Toddler daughter was awaiting her milk during this time.
Title: Good location, poor overall for the £255 paid for 1 night, given the issues faced.

Positive_reviews: I booked a breakfast receptionist had no record, I then paid on arrival leaving there was no record of paying, I had to produce the receipt.
Negative_reviews: I asked for upgrade and girl on reception said there was a record on system but didn't offer upgrade or ask why she couldn't, I felt embarrassed asking requests ignored.
Title: Beautiful place cleaning staff excellent but not happy no attempt upgrade

The carpets were not hoovered from Saturday morning until when we left on Sunday morning.  Also the corridors are very dark.  White walls would make

Title: Birthday stay

Negative_reviews:
We had trouble finding your place.
We took a train from Edinburgh and found it very difficult to get to your place from the train station.
You should, on your web-site, mention how to get to your place if someone is carrying a couple of suitcases.
Luckily, a nice kind lady inside the Waverly station told us to take the escalators all the way up to Princes St. and walk down on North Bridge St.  towards your place.

We also had trouble adjusting the room temperature.

Positive_reviews: We have stayed here a few times as the location is fantastic.
Negative_reviews:
When we got to the room there was dirty ware and glasses on the floor outside. On entering the room the sheets on the bed looked as if they had been slept on and made up badly. 
The staff gave us another room but to be honest the sheets in the newly allocated room were only marginally better. 
On one of the days, no bath towels were left in the bathroom. 
There was mould at the bottom of the bath glass. 
Whilst we stayed in the hotel there was a fire scare. We had to vacate it at around 6.30am. 
We were very surprised that not one member of staff approached us to take our names/room number or to tell us when to return. There was no apology or explanation. While I realize that the fire alert may not have been the hotels fault, I feel that the situation was handled extremely unprofessionally.
Title: Very disappointed this time

Positive_reviews: Room size and furnishings are good. Access to the car park and local amenities, including the Castle, and the tour guides meeting point couldn't be better. Clean and comfortable.
Negative_reviews: Expected to be greeted by a Scots person on the front desk. Breakfast food quality was poor and the Coffee is not as you good as you get in Europe. Soggy Croissants.  AC in the room didn't allow us to put heat on ? No heated towel rail in the bathroom. If you order a gin & Tonic you'll be charged for the Gin and then the tonic!

What should have been a restful holiday was ruined for us because of this. Hotel staff friendly and helpful but this did not make up for the frequent, noisey disturbances.

Positive_reviews: Close to city centre. Comfortable beds.
Negative_reviews: Worst ever checking in experience. A male receptionist with poor command of English was extraordinarily curt and unhelpful. Extortionately expensive at over £400 per room per night. No way could that price ever be acceptable or justifiable for such an average quality hotel and one which was not nearly sufficiently staffed to cope with a very busy period during the Edinburgh Festival. The bar area at 6.30pm was a scene of utter chaos. Dreadful service for a supposed 4 Star hotel charging such enormously high prices. Would never ever return.

Title: A huge disappointment for what we had been told was a five star hotel

Positive_reviews: This hotel sadly lives off its location!  A great location for sure on the Royal Mile however a very tired hotel (buckets to catch the leaking roof).  Breakfast was also very good.
Negative_reviews: Tired hotel - staff with no passion for good customer service!  Location is excellent but do yourself a favor and book a hostel (lots nearby) tired hotel tired rooms, we paid £719 for 2 nights!!!  Way over priced!

Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Location is great. Right on the royal mile so very convenient
Negative_reviews:
Upon receiving an email offering an upgrade for purchase we agreed to a superior room for an extra £20 per night offering a view of Arthur’s Seat. 
Upon entering our room the  view was out of a window 2 feet square. Very small. Yes you could see Arthur’s seat but.....
The room smelled like a fire had been in the room. In the evening sitting on the bed and not touching it the bedside lamp fell off the wall. The night staff very quickly came up and fixed it
The next day when we were ready to go out and explore we went to use the safe and it didn’t work. A screw holding the outlet was just about out
There was mould on the window ledge. 
The head board which was metallic was almost worn off. 
We went and spoke with the manager Brian and he offered to go look at our room. When we got back there was a little fruit basket in the room. Safe still not fixed. Screw removed from the outlet but not fixed
No other contact from staff about the room other than a fruit basket which we received at 6pm and we were leaving the next day so not able to enjoy at all. 
This room was at most a 2-3 star room. Would not go back
Title: Not a 4 star hotel

Positive_reviews: the room itself was perfect very nice spacious room with a great shower

We find duvets too hot so on cruise ships and in hotels we always ask for the duvet to be removed and a sheet a blanket put on the bed in its place.
Housekeeping just couldn’t figure it out even after they made the bed the way we asked the first day. We eventually just put out the do not disturb sign to take away the frustration.
Also every morning at 7am someone is recycling glass bottles fir half an hour in the courtyard.  We did not need a wake up call because of this.
Radisson blu did not give us points because we booked through booking.com,

Yesterday morning the cooked breakfast was also luke warm, also there was no smoked salmon either day.  The tablenext to ours yesterday morning had water spilled on the floor which was left. Title: interesting edinburgh . very good experience to visit this great city

Negative_reviews:
Aloof disinterest of reception staff on arrival.
1 mini bottle of shampoo and shower gel between 2 people. 
Miserly amount of tea bags/milk.
No bath robes. 
I realise that we only had a standard room however I think £823 for 4 nights  warrants a few extras. 
Clarity needed for room service charges.
Confusion regarding bill at checkout was upsetting and frankly spoilt our special long awaited break.
Title: Disappointing.

Positive_reviews: Location and use of car park
Negative_reviews:
Took two attempts to get bedding changed from Down to non allergenic, could have been a disaster as wife very allergic to feathers. 
Breakfasts poor, cold and overcooked food which appeared to have been in trays for too long, tasteless black pudding, awful fried eggs first day too many in tray and a congealed mess in tray. Not much better second day when ordered poached eggs which eventually tuned up cold and solid. 
Dining facilities poor with not very interesting choice on menu. staff in dining area inattentive and had to be chased to get any type of service.
Title: Over priced. with less than three star service in what was surposded to be a foor star hotel.

Negative_reviews: The waterproof mattress cover is horrible.  Very uncomfortable and makes you sweat. This is a hotel not a nursing home.
Title: Would have been great except for the terrible plastic mattress cover.

Positive_reviews: Bed comfortable, location good
Negative_reviews:
Noisy bars next door didn’t get to sleep until 3am when they’d closed. Also bed was set up as a twin when arrived even though double was requested. 
We’ve stayed here before in a superior room and it wasn’t noisy like this one.
Title: Pay extra for a superior room away from noisy bars if staying here

Positive_reviews: The front desk staff were all brilliant. Very polite and very helpful. I didn't get their names but there was an Irish girl, an African chap and an American chap. They could teach the restaurant staff a thing or two about providing a service. We arrived early and checked in but the room wasn't ready so they took our bags and we went for lunch. The room was nice and clean. The shower was really powerful. The bed was extremely comfortable. No complaints about the room at all.
Negative_reviews: The buffet breakfast was terrible, probably the worst I've ever had. The staff were unfriendly and had absolutely no manners. The maitre'D (Tracy Ho) didn't appear to have please or thank you in her vocabulary. One of those who gave instructions whilst looking elsewhere rather than talking to us because she was bored of saying the same thing a 100 times. Staff were taking plates whilst one of us were still eating. The quality of food was awful. For example the bacon seemed to have just been thrown on the grill in clumps of about 8 slices so the outer 2 slices were virtually burnt with the inside slices cooked but insipid. The fried eggs were like rubber frisbees and the hash browns were inedible. I didn't try anything else as I went to look at the porridge and it was so thick it wouldn't come off the spoon so I gave up. I had tea to drink and there were 2 teabags in a large pot so no matter how long I left it and squoze the bags it was still extremely weak. I think the breakfast was £12.95 each. A total waste of money
Title: Don't bother with the breakfast

Negative_reviews:
Breakfast was poor - over cooked and left on hot plate. 
Queuing due to weekend rush !!

Negative_reviews: I suspect you have new staff in the hotel? Poor check in... confusion as to whether my room was ready or not at 9.00pm.

Dining room not great for breakfast. Felt cold, stark.
Everything else in the hotel was good except - when we arrived the fourth floor rooms were being cleaned and the corridors were very messy with last nights booze glasses lined you outside the doors.
In the hotel bar I ordered a medium glass of Pinot Noir wine and a pot of tea at approx 10pm. I was charged £15.50. I nearly dropped. With a tip for a nice barman it came to £17.50 for a nite-cap. And one drink was tea!
Title: Everything was good except - when we arrived the fourth floor rooms were being cleaned and the

Negative_reviews: Woke up by fire alarm, bar staff in evening very unprofessional, when checking in we had several questions about upgrading our room it felt a bit like nagging, then we were asked what floor what we want to stay on it was just several questions from the get go. The bar staff were swearing and were very slow.
Title: Would not stay again no value for money

Positive_reviews:
Would have liked better bathroom accessories I. e toothbrush, toothpaste for forgetful young one. Only one bath, shampoo and lotion for two people??
No cotton wool, buds etc as is expected in a room of high standard! But, bed was extremely comfortable!

Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Great location and upon asking for a room with a bigger window since ours looked dingy and was broken at the frame we were given a free upgrade.
Negative_reviews: Broken window frame at top in first room causing draft (window was also tiny), bed not king as requested (2 singles pushed together not best for couples),  rooms not dusted as mirrors very dusty near lights, bedding not changed only remade, blood on pillows, unfriendly bar staff didn't seem like they cared at all, having to call repeatedly to sort an issue on more than one occasion, charged for calls to reception to complain, broken bits falling off headboard. Appreciated room upgrade but still dirty and sofa had a lot of white stains so did not use at all. See photos. Hotel has a lot of potential and on another stay may be better but this time there was a lot to improve of which impacted our stay.
Title: Could be a lot better

Negative_reviews: The price and I could hear all the drunks outside also

The bed was very uncomfortable. It has a mattress topper on which kept moving, it also absorbed the heat from my body on a night so the bed got very hot, at one point I had to get up and I felt the bed where I was laying which was very hot to touch. 
Pillows also were poor. No filling in them so had to fold them over to get a decent pillow.
All in all a very poor sleep on both night of our stay

It caused uncomfortable experience staying in the room. Ventilation system in the bathroom was not working so it was very stuffy during and after showerpillows and even when the door was closed for a few minutes. The lack of fresh air in the room affects some breathing difficulties when staying in the room. Wish improvements will be made and provide better service to customers.

Negative_reviews: Room had not been properly serviced and used tea/coffee left out. Complained after night 1. Nothing done prior to night 2. Checked out early after night 2 but haven't heard from Hotel. I have used these Hotels in many places and arranged for others. It has always been consistent. As I haven't heard back from them, the group has just lost tens of thousands of pounds of future business. Thisxwas an excellent Hotel - as the, Scandic - many years ago. They have evidently become complacent.
Title: Enough to make me cancel tens of thousands of £ potential bookings with them. No attn to detail.

Positive_reviews:
All staff were very friedndly, helpful and professional. Door Key fob operted every time without any trouble. Much better than having to use those unreliable swipe cards! Cofffee at breakdfast was very good.
Shampoo & shower gel in the swimming pool changing rooms.
Negative_reviews:
There are no tea plates available during breakfast so you have to use a dinner plate instead. No saucers either so wet teaspoons lie on the table. The bacon tastes like cardboard.
There's no air conditioning instructions.. My wife was freezing - waring 3 layers in bed (-2C outside). The next night & after many attempts to sort the problem, Reception operated it centrally. They said the Fan symbol with an "A" just blew out air but didnt change the temperature. How is anyone supposed to know that? Apparantly iit can take up to 20 minutes to reach the set temperature. We were told it wasn't the first time this has happened & they would report it to managment in the morning. Why hasn't "managment" sorted this out previously? Apart from these issues
Title: If the air conditioning is sorted out, we would recommend the hotel.

Positive_reviews: Really comfortable bed and excellent location
Negative_reviews: There were people using drugs in the stair well leading from the car park. The bathroom glass shelves were thick with dust. The swimming pool was cold and there was no hot tub/jacuzzi. One of the bar stuff was rude whilst having a drink at the bar.

Title: Pleasant

Negative_reviews:
Noise, there's a popular bar right in front of our window, you can count on hearing the chatting & laughter till 2am.
Extremely rude reception- a mid-age woman, who checked us in.
Title: Fair

Positive_reviews: Room was nice looking and comfortable and hotel situated in a good place. That's all.
Negative_reviews:
Paid £260 for one night we went to check in and told our room wasn't ready but should be ready in an hour so we went back in an hour and told it still wasn't ready then went back again and told to wait another 20 minutes. As it was Christmas market time there wasn't anywhere to sit in whilst we waited as most places were too busy to get a seat. So we were left just walking about. I have something wrong with my stomach so this wasn't ideal at all as I was in alot of pain that day and was struggling. 
We finally got checked in and there wasn't even an apology or that for our wait. Prior to us coming I emailed asking to put balloon and that in room (paid extra) for my partners birthday and they said was ok for that to happen but didn't at all. Room was lovely but for the price we paid thought would have got treated alot better than that.
Title: Not great for price

Negative_reviews: Restaurant, bar

Negative_reviews:
Price - after upgrading and paying what I did I really expected a luxury stay - not so!
Room - 2 of the lights werent working (main lights) and despite 2 maid visits, no fix
View - I paid for a hill/castle view - the window was in the very far corner of the room and if I stood on one leg on my tip toes, straining my neck I could potentially have seen the top of the hill - again, after paying to upgrade, not at all what I expected.
Title: Disappointing, expensive stay.......made up for by the city and events on during the weekend

Negative_reviews: shampoo, soap, etc. very poor
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: Nice Hotel in The Royal Mile, very clean y very good breakfast
Title: Very Poor

Positive_reviews: The room was good and clean & the staff were very friendly and helpful
Negative_reviews: The billing system created a lot of confusion. They charged me twice and their POS machine and hotel systems just didn't synch and created a lot of confusion. I had to make international calls to my bank to clarify to the hotel that the card had been charged, whilst the payment just didn't reflect on the hotels systems. They need to upgrade that as that impacts the customer experience severely.
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Good location, rooms reasonably large, good wifi.
Negative_reviews: Mattress was hard and uncomfortable. Bathroom was not clean, room decore was as attractive as a 1970s office foyer, with brown and grey retro furnishing. Our room was not ready when we arrived, and we were offered an upgrade to a suite (note, not a free upgrade though) which after 36 hours travelling sounded like a good idea. It was the ugliest suite I have ever stayed in, and was expensive. Power cables across the floor, mould in the bathroom. On checking out, the gentleman at reception was impersonal and disinterested - no more money to be had, I guess.
Title: I would not stay here again.

Positive_reviews: The location is without a doubt one of the best things about the hotel.  Staff are friendly and very keen to help and knowledgeable.  Breakfast was outstanding and started our day off well.  The carpark although hidden around the back of the hotel is large and easy to access and the discount from the hotel is a plus.
Negative_reviews: Finding a pair of knickers in the room that did not belong to my wife was not pleasant.  Also as we needed none allergenic bedding and pillows this left us with no bed topping.  Two beds pushed together were uncomfortable as you could feel the edges.  Also the doors to the rooms bang close so in a morning you can hear everyone getting up (don’t need an alarm or wake up call).  The smallest pool ever seen to match the small changing rooms.  More than two people in either and that’s them full.
Title: Excellent location but need to work on small details as rooms let this hotel down.

Positive_reviews: The hotel is in a fantastic location, great for exploring the city. The bar staff were the best within the hotel - very polite, helpful and friendly. The breakfast was of good quality.
Negative_reviews: We booked this hotel stay to celebrate a milestone wedding anniversary. When using the pool/sauna facilities, the staff were rather ignorant and unhelpful when I pointed out that there was no water available and that there were piles of empty cups left around. This made me question the cleanliness of the area as obviously no-one was checking to refill the water or clean up. Similarly in the dining area for breakfast, the staff were not particularly attentive. Our table had no milk on for our coffees and when I pointed this out to a staff member he just moodily placed one in front of me. The dining area itself is incredibly tight, with very little space between each table. I felt like we were dining with a group of other people as they were so close together! Simple things like tables spread out more and tablecloths on the tables would have made the place much nicer. I also thought the room was a let down to what was pictured prior to booking - just a plain white bedsheet hastily made, no bed runner on which I thought made the rooms look appealing in the pictures. We had told them of our anniversary prior to our stay and we did have someone come to our room with a card and gift, which was a nice gesture. However the card was just addressed to myself (not the both of us - then saying Happy Anniversary - which obviously means two people are involved) and handed us one little bag with fudge in and one drinks voucher. Gave me another fudge bag when saw 2 of us. Considering it's obviously for an anniversary it would be common sense to provide two drinks vouchers so that as a couple we could enjoy our drink together. As a manager previously, I thought this just showed little thought in the actual gesture itself as there is no point providing one gesture when the celebration is obviously for two people. Overall I thought the hotel let itself down and didn't meet my expectations, which for an anniversary celebration, is sad.
Title: Didn't meet standards - room a disappointment, moody staff and cramped dining area.

Positive_reviews:
Sadly our stay was not as memorable as it should be due to a fire drill during the night where the fire evacuation process was very poor. There were no correct evacuation process, no fire wardens on sight when we had to evacuate. I had to wake my young children and have to go down 6 flight of stairs into the freezing cold in the middle of the night. The most disturbing thing is that the fire alarm was triggered by someone smoking on site. To our disappointment, the hotel did not take into account the distress me and my young children had to face in the middle of the night out, having to risk going down these stairs while children were half asleep into the freezing cold, extremely frightened. The hotel took no responsibility to the distress and discomfort caused to my young children. 
We tried to ask for a refund for the distress and disturbance caused. The reason I am writing this review is not that of the false alarm and but the hotel management did not seem to be too concerned about our ordeal we faced or the fact the incidence could have cost us our lives.
Negative_reviews: poor response from Hotel Management
Title: Okay

Positive_reviews: Beds comfy
Negative_reviews: Breakfast poor value, not tasty
Title: Good

Positive_reviews: Hotel team should improve!
Title: Pleasant

Positive_reviews: nice big bed and very comfy
Negative_reviews: A very noisy room lots of out side noise and the fire alarm going off at 12 o'clock at night. The bar area was very messy with lots of glasses everywhere felt more like a conference hotel rather than a luxury hotel. Having a drink in the bar ,staff where arranging tables all around us felt in the way so left. Its a shame as we have stayed in this hotel chain many times and think this was the untidiest. Think the conference people took over some what felt really uncomfortable .
Title: noce hotel stunning from the out side just don't stay on level 5.

Positive_reviews: The location was superb - very central and next to a lot of attractions that we wanted to visit. We never walked more than 8 minutes to get where we wanted.
Negative_reviews:
After checking in at approximately 3pm, we left our room for some shopping. Upon our return it became obvious that someone had been in our room as there were some minor changes to the suite. Bedsheets had been adjusted and all of the curtains had been drawn, this wouldn’t prove to be an issue however when you know you are in possession of a number of valuables I didn’t appreciate this. 
Further to this, and more annoyingly, at approximately 12am the fire alarm began to ring out, we very quickly left the room to discover a minor state of panic amongst other guests. Of course as a health and safety procedure this wouldn’t be an issue, but what was a concern was the fact that there was no sign of any staff members in order to better organise the panic of the situation. We headed outside only to be ushered round the corner by a staff member on a cigarette break. There was no attempt to head count/ensure that everyone was evacuated and then later accounted for upon returning into the building. There was a considerate lack of communication regarding what had caused the alarm, and what the resolution had been. This is concerning given the presence of two fire engines.
The following morning we received a knock on the door to fill up the mini bar for the next guests, despite us requesting a late check out. At this point we were still getting ready for the day. 
Lastly, the light on the side of the wardrobe (above the kettle) was flickering throughout the night despite being switched off which prevented a good nights sleep.
Title: Didn’t meet expectations

Positive_reviews: X
Negative_reviews: X

Title: I'LL be back

Positive_reviews: Close to everything; Edinburgh Castle, museum, national gallery, beautiful architecture everywhere. Even late night convenience store a few minutes walk. Hop-on Hop-off stop <100m outside the hotel. City cabs directly outside hotel at all times. Pubs and restaurants all around. Beautiful part of town. The trip was for a birthday celebration so I went for a premium room, room only. Room was large, quiet, clean and well decorated, modern, looking onto the Royal Mile. Bed was a super king and comfortable. Corner sofa was a nice place to have our room service. Blackout curtains. Good mirror with lighting, shelf and 2 sockets was great for makeup and drying hair. We were able to broadcast netflix to the tv from my tablet. Lots of nice little touches like robes, slippers, coffee machine, pillow spray, complimentary water and even a free beer. Air con was great to adjust room temp. We really enjoyed our stay. Oh and shower was powerful and had an adjustable shower head. Felt they thought of everything.

Title: On the whole a very pleasant stay.

Positive_reviews: The breakfasts were one of the best I have seen in a long time from fish to fry, freshly cooked breads etc. By standards of Radisson this has been one of my favourite stays. There was complimentary water in the room and free white and chocolate chip cookies in the lobby along with fruit. It was in a really convenient location to view the castle. The bedroom had a lovely view and was very comfy and clean.
Negative_reviews: We prepaid for our stay on a card that I wouldn't use very regularly for safety therefore had little money in the account, the person that checked us in took an additional amount without consent which left my account balance in debt and I had to notify my back which was inconvenient. We were offered free breakfast for this mistake which was good customer service.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Rooms clean, comfortable and stylish. Staff friendly and helpful.
Negative_reviews: Although the rooms themselves were very clean and there are no complaints here, the same could not always be said for the corridors between rooms which looked like they still needed a good vacuum when we arrived about between 3 and 4pm. Perhaps left over from room cleaning earlier?  (This improved later in tbe evening.) Also, on one occasion on our last day, the elavator to the car park had some maggots on the floor in the corner. This was witnessed by one of the cleaning staff who said she'd get somebody onto it. Perhaps somebody had dropped some food in the past. These lifts would also be accessible to the public via the car park,  though residents are protected against unauthorized entry via key card access between the lift and the hotel room corridors.

Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Facilities were great. Lots of personal touches. The bed was really comfortable and felt luxurious. The staff and customer service was excellent they were friendly and helpful throughout our whole stay. The food was excellent.. Lovely cuisine and good variety. Leisure facilities and pool was also great.
Negative_reviews: Just at the salon they were advertising services they didnt always have on offer. Eg a hot stones massage I booked for my partner was cancelled abd rearranged to another treatment as they didn't have a qualified member of staff trained in that technique. Bit disappointing though the treatment he ended  up with was good.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: The bed was wonderful. Big and comfortable. We got more pillows when we asked. The room was a good size.
Negative_reviews: A spare blanket would have been nice. I was a bit cold. And a comfy chair each; only one of us could sit in the evening before bed. Overall very good.
Title: Wonderful

Positive_reviews: The bed was extra comfy and the location was great.
Negative_reviews: The sticky toffee pudding was dry and chocolate covered.
Title: Staff was great and expecting my arrival;  the room was great and easy to fall asleep.

Positive_reviews:
Position.
Pool
Spa
Comfy room
Negative_reviews: Breakfast was expensive. Only had once. Ate out other days which was better value and just as good.
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Location was amazing . Also extremely comfortable and clean .
Negative_reviews: N/a
Title: Exceptional

Positive_reviews: Both great. The beds were very comfortable and cosy. The rooms were very clean and we had a good view outside. The architectural style of the building is fabulous.
Negative_reviews: More lifts are required and they need to be much bigger for suitcases etc.
Title: We had a fantastic experience and we will stay at this hotel if you have some offers re price.

Positive_reviews: Everything was so luxurious.
Negative_reviews: There was nothing we didn't like.
